Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly very nice!”
Reviews.Author: maggie s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December. The staff were very friendly and efficient and the hotel was clean and tidy. The food was tasty, fresh tasting and the portions were of a good size. Har to fault really. Nice, pleasant place. Would stay here again definately.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get off to a great start”
Reviews.Author: Eliot22
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the many good reviews it has received on Tripadvisor. The risk that you run by doing so is that you start expecting something truly marvellous and it can only disappoint. Let me start by saying that most of the staff are indeed very friendly but it is hit and miss. Some of them speak hardly any English, which can be difficult indeed, especially when your room isn't satisfactory for particular reasons. Another example is that I asked for assistance with an airport transfer to and from Fiumicino the day after I landed. I gave the receptionist the details (a one-day trip to Cagliari) but I was only given a taxi to Fiumicino. There was no one picking me up on my return. More frustrating was the fact that my room was simply not satisfactory, as mentioned before. Only two lights were working on about 25 watts and this did not exactly light up my room. I arrived late and my room was dark, also owing to the fact that the shutters were shut. Normally this is no problem but because the room was so dark, I could not find the switch to operate the shutters (yes, I felt like there was a hidden camera somewhere as I was 'feeling' all the walls for clues). To add insult to injury the shower hook was broken, which meant I had to hold it in a funny angle to get wet, causing the stream to turn into a drip. In the morning I tried to raise the issues with the night clerk but he spoke no English whatsoever and I knew that nothing was making sense, so I hoped that the cleaners might spot the darkness. They did not and I took another two rounds to reception that evening to get things sorted. When I came back from my dinner, around eleven thirty, I could happily report that most items were fixed and found (in case of the shutter switch - next to the bed duh). The shower is still an issue because it hangs at such an angle that you cannot flood the whole of your bathroom and every bathroom beneath you. As I mentioned, throughout all of this the staff were really friendly and not necessarily unhelpful by choice, just unhelpful by default. I was offered not to pay tourist tax. They didn't say why but I suppose it was because of the issues with the room. Sad to say, I probably would not recommend this hotel, purely on the basis that people who only stay a short time and have genuinely little time to spend, there were too many issues to get resolved just in order to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SteveS19046
Reviews.Content: Traveling as part of a small group (8) we spent 3 nights in this centrally located boutique hotel near the Termini transportation center. As usual in large European cities the rooms are small not unlike those in older east coast American cities like NY, Boston and Philadelphia and the shower stalls are smaller yet. There is an encloseable outdoor area with tables that provided a wonderful place for our group to meet and discuss the day over a glass of wine before embarking on dinner plans. The hotel is clean, towels generous and staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included daily and again was very nice and typical for Euro-style breakfast- not lavish but generally heathy and very tasty. My only complaint was that the refrigerator (mini-bar?) was not cold and even after attention by staff never worked. There also was a bit of late noise- not partiers but workers doing something a few doors down at very late hours. Certainly not something the hotel had control over but it did affect our opinion of our stay. All in all I would recommend this hotel based on the service, clenliness and location.

Reviews.Title: “A Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Mario514
Reviews.Content: When we got to Rome we did not not know what to expect out of this hotel that we reserved from Montreal , Canada. From the first moment we arrived we knew we had made the right choice. Bruno and Alessandro were exceptional at the front desk. The room was perfect. The location was great and walking distance to all the major attractions. the little covered terrace was beautiful, especially with a glass of the house red. Breakfast was more than enough. Everything was super clean, and the room itself was quite large for european standards and had new fixtures. I would return again tomorrow if I could. I would encourage everyone to give it a try when in Rome. Kristin & Mario ciao

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but with a caveat”
Reviews.Author: Necritic-in-Indy
Reviews.Content: I too just managed to visit Rome for the lovely snow fall and Indiana winter weather and was pleased that I had full control over the rooms temperature. (Although... the cleaning staff seemed to think we needed fresh air and kept leaving the windows open.) MOST of the staff are helpful and pleasant. There is free wifi, when it is working. The rooms were in fact pleasantly large for a boutique hotel, BUT they could have done with an extra outlet and a little more storage. (A coat hook or two would have been nice.) But... by far the greatest failing was the bathroom. First... we stayed for 7 nights and had to request toilet paper 6 of those days. (I'm glad I always travel with a roll or two... at least to save a little space and for emergencies or packing material.) I never understood them, leaving the toilet paper holder empty. Bizarre. But the bathroom in general was terrible. The shower was LITERALLY... a 2x2-ft space... glass sides... with no place to put your soap or bottles. (And at 6'2", I couldn't even put my shampoo on the floor of the shower as I could not then reach it.) If you wished to stand in front of the sink, you could either stand in the toilet or you could stand between them... with your calves pressed against the toilet and your thighs against the sink. Oh... but the bidet seemed to have plenty of space. And before you think they needed space for the door to open into the room (no... it didn't open out either), it was a pocket door. Worst bathroom layout ever. The room was not particularly quiet as we were not far from Nazionale (a very busy thoroughfare) and over a restaurant/bar that seemed to generate a loud crowd around midnight. I was surprised though... the bed was not as hard as is usual for Europe. Lastly... the hotel is fantastically placed. A 2-3 minute walk to Republica puts you on the most useful of the subway lines for tourism. Termini - the central train station - is only one stop away and lets you change to the other line useful for tourists. And, the noisy-customer-generating-restaurant below is quite good and reasonable... another bonus of the site.

Reviews.Title: “Snowy Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sid666
Reviews.Content: Picked the first time in 26 years to coincide with first snow in Rome and did it, two blizzards in two days. Hotel staff extremely helpful arranged transport and advice on closest good restaurants, which were also excellent. Rooms were pleasantly large for a boutique hotel and free Internet comes with the deal. Only minor fault, dining room for breakfast is small and can't cater for a full hotel. Proximity to historical sites is good but beware of the scourge of pickpockets, particularly on the packed buses

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good service”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. There are actually 2 hotels run by the same people, the Bellesuites, and the Hotel Adler. I booked the Bellesuite on lasminute.com and when we arrived we were given a room in the Adler. We didn't realise we had been put in the wrong hotel until we complained about the street noise from our room, and were moved from the 3rd night onwards upstairs into a Bellesuite room. This was much much nicer. The room didn't overlook the street and was on the floor above the reception and dining room so it was much quiter. For the price we paid I thought it was excellent value for money. It was conviently located near Republica so easy walking distance from Termini. It was about a 10 minute walk to the Trevi area and about the same down to the Roman Forum area. I quite like to have a wander around so this location was great for us, but if you prefer to stay right in the central areas and not have to walk anywhere then maybe look elsewhere, but I doubt you will find anything any better value for money in Rome. A couple of other helpful tips. 1) the breakfast coffee was excellent, definitely one of the best in Rome! 2) If you want to eat closer to the hotel then I would recommend 'Al Viminale' (Piazza del Viminale, 3, Rome, Italy). It is only a few minutes walk away and is a small family run restaurant, really cheap, and really great pasta and homemade Tiramisu. Definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A most wonderful start to our Italy vacation!”
Reviews.Author: MrsRatch
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were greeted by friendly helpful staff who showed us to and around our room and the hotel. It was also our arrival in Italy, and the airline had lost our luggage. The Bellesuite staff was most helpful with this issue, by contacting the airline for us numerous times, and pointing us in the right direction to pick up a few necessaties and clothes that we would need while in wait of the luggage. The lobby, hall and rooms were sparkling clean and full of character. Our room was spacious and charming. Breakfast was adequate and the terrace was a very lovely spot to have breakfast or a glass of wine later in the day. We would stay here again, and would recommend it to others. The location was good. We walked everywhere that we needed to go in the city...Vatican, Spanish Steps, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: pajass
Reviews.Content: Right from the moment you walk in, this hotel feels right. It's modern, clean and has really good staff. The location is really central and the double glazing means you don't get any street noise. The sky bar is great and breakfast is very good with a wider choice than you normally get on the continent (OK - they can't do bacon as we know it). I recommend a room with a balcony if possible. All rooms are air conditioned which is great when it's so hot and all rooms have a safe. I have no criticisms whatsoever and would recommend ti to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tarles
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean rooms & very helfpul staff (Alessandro & Bruno were great!). It was a close walk to the train station (Tremini) and in a very central location to all of the big sites - we walked almost everywhere. The quaint set-up (especially for breakfast) made it great for chatting with other travellers & exchanging tips. Only downside is that the bathroom is very small (even for Europe).

Reviews.Title: “charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: hanna m
Reviews.Content: we would like to thank you all the staff at Bellesuite , they were so nice and welcoming very helpfull . bruno alessandro martin grazii . the hotel is little but so charming with great amenities and the location is perfect right in the centre. If you are not looking Sheraton hotels , this is the place....

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: notnecessary
Reviews.Content: There's good news and bad news. If one is only seeking a very affordable Rome hotel then this is it. The A/C worked (marvelously in August), the shower was hot, rooms clean and internet wifi was included. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is good, just off Piazza Republica near the Metro and Via Nazionale. But. The hotel is very small, elevator is two persons max. The rooms are ready for an upgrade. Breakfast is included but is continental only, no hot items. The hotel with which Bellesuites is associated is a two star and that would be the rating of this establishment also. Clean but basic, don't plan your honeymoon here.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Randall32
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the cleanest, best maintained, friendliest foreign hotel we have ever patronized. Alessandro, Bruno, Michaelangelo, and Luccina could not have been more pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was scrumptious and the terrace setting made it even better. The best cappuccino we had in all of Rome! For our future travels to Rome we will certainly return to this quaint hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jjanda4200
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the first week of June. Our room on the 3rd floor was very spacious. Good air conditioning. Very clean. Location one block from the metro station Repubblica was only one stop to transfer from line A and B at Termini. Bruno at the front desk has great restaurant suggestions! The bathroom was small but served it's purpose. The stand up shower was snug for my husband. Overall, great hotel, nice staff, good location. Would definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to get back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: Thomasjp
Reviews.Content: i was there for 3 nights was cozy familiar style like old times breakfast excellent and was perfect for staying there near everything perfect

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: Konstas1970
Reviews.Content: It´s a great place to have a for a memorable vacation. Very kind people ready to meet any customer need. The rooms are really comfortable and have all the necessary amenities you may need for your holiday. I would definitely return as I have very good memories!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews helped us to decide.”
Reviews.Author: geoffando
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel were mostly positive and rightly so, this is a lovely little hotel, clean, friendly and most importantly well located,would stay here again, my wife and I had a fantastic visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but the rooms seem a bit 'tired' compared with last time we stayed”
Reviews.Author: chicken01706
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel before and although our room was nice our friends' room was too small. The shower door wouldn't open fully as the sink was in the way and there was no room to get dried in the bathroom. Service is good and staff are friendly. Saying this I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: antris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights with my friend and I have to say this was the best hotel experience I've had in Italy. The staff was always helpful and polite and the rooms were super clean. The shower only had warm water for 20 seconds at a time after it turned cold. Also, the breakfast is included and they make cappuccino on request, but the food is without much variety and I had real trouble eating anything on the third time. Our room window was also facing a busy street, which meant that a light sleeper might have trouble. These three things are the only thing that bothered me, and they're just small details when you consider the low price. The location was good, really close to the Republica metro station, and every major sight was also walkable to us. I can't imagine a better overall value for Rome considering my past experiences in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JasonD_11
Reviews.Content: The most friendly and welcoming hotel I have ever stayed at. I have stayed there twice now, in 2007, and 2011. Alessandro and Bruno treat you as if you were a guest in their own home. I was there for our honeymoon and they left a bottle of great italian liquor and cookies, and when we went out to eat they called the restaurants to inform the owners and we received special treatment. The staff is great and always ready to answer any questions and even help teach some usable italian phrases. The location is amazing as well, walking distance to just about everything you'll want to see. I recommended this hotel to my cousin and he will be staying there for his honeymoon in June.

Reviews.Title: “A good base - well located and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rad_2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located – safe area, within 30 mins walk of many sites like Coliseum / Spanish Steps / Pantheon etc. Easy bus ride to Vatican. 15 mins walk from the main train station, which is what you use to reach Rome from the airport. Extremely well kept and clean, decent décor, more so than most 3/4 star places I’ve stayed in. Staff are friendly and go the extra mile, they kept our bags after checkout so we could get a full day in. They even checked my flight time for me online. Breakfast included proper cappuccino. Free internet handy. I could hear the traffic a bit from my room in the morning, but I was pleased to be so central – so no big deal - especially for a long weekend. Mattress a bit firmer than most. Rome is beautiful, with this place you are right in it, but nicely away from the crowded tourist hotspots. I give it the thumbs up for price range. When eating out, beware if prices are not shown. We picked a few simple dishes from a glass display that were reheated in the microwave. The bill was 50 euros! In another restaurant our waiter made it clear that although there was a 10% service charge on the bill (not cover charge), we needed to leave extra in order to tip him. Tourists are fare game. We landed on our feet in other places and ate well for a very fare price. Rome is the perfect destination of you like culture, food, shopping, history and people watching. Loved our trip. Would go back to this hotel without a question.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Bellesuites”
Reviews.Author: JeevesNapa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2009/January 2010, and the whole team at the hotel were exceptional - Allessandro, Bruno - everyone. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. They made us feel so welcome, and made arrangements for trains, visits to museums, etc. We also recommended the hotel to other family members visiting Rome, and they also loved it. Loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Charme”
Reviews.Author: firaus
Reviews.Content: Nice and charme little hotel ..the room was quite spacious and the breakfast area was relaxing with lounge bar and terrace! Best cappuccino ever . Staff were very willing to answer any questions and help. There was free internet.” one of my best stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location, kind staff”
Reviews.Author: LucasPaul
Reviews.Content: Very kind and helpful staff, nice, quiet and clean rooms, very good location. We were glad that we could use the air conditioning as heating in wintertime. Breakfast was not as good as one would expect, fresh made pastries or fresh fruit juice were missing, choice of cheese or ham could be better. Due to low water pressure, very little water was running when someone else in a different room had water on. But overall, the hotel was a nice experience and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Kenedie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bellesuites for two nights on our arrival in Rome. A very easy walk from the Termini if you pack reasonably light. Rome is a great walking city and we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. That said, the Repubblica Metro stop is close by. Breakfast was good and filling and the cappuccino was wonderful. We enjoyed both the staff and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: NACW944
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and our first leg was Rome & the Bellesuite . The hotel was rcommended by an old friend who is a travel guide. The room was very bright, very clean..alittle small. The bathroom was comfortable and all systems worked just fine! The location was great and the staff was amazing. Allessandro and Bruno made the visit even more spectacular. They assisted in attraction tickets, train reservations, taxi reservations, great dinner reccomendations and a great wine shop. We were very happy there and will definitely return! This hotel was our first impression of Italy and Italian hospitality and made the trip begin on a perfect note!

Reviews.Title: “good value and very good location”
Reviews.Author: janai51
Reviews.Content: Our party of four found this hotel to be just what we needed. Very clean and presentable and the staff very attentive.The rooms were quiet and comfortable. The position is excellent for visiting Rome and the reception desk is manned throughout the night so one can get back at any time of night. On the second day of our stay we met the delightful Bruno who was charming and friendly. His kind manner and extremely helpful attitude made one feel that this hotel would definitely be very welcoming on a return visit and their little 'motto' of A HOME AWAY FROM HOME was clearly the aim.

Reviews.Title: “No thrills but made ticked most boxes”
Reviews.Author: ritchiejc
Reviews.Content: As many other reviews have mentioned, this can be hard place to find on Via Modena. The entrance is used by othe "chains" of hoteliers too and can be found at the top of the street looking towards the Republica and away from the city, it will be on your right. Once found and squeezed into the oldest (but quaint) lift in the world, Bellesuites Reception can be found on the 2nd Floor. Check-in was fine and we were shown to our room on the 3rd floor. I have not seen a room key ie a metal thing in years! But thats what you get. Anyway the room had a large double (2 singles together but hardly noticeable) bed and single bed(?). It had hanging space, drawers, TV with Sky (Italian style), mini bar/fridge, phone, electronic safe and hair drier (the smallest ever). It did not have a kettle/tea/coffe, radio (tho MTV available on TV). The bathroom was amazing......no I mean amazing by its weird design! Floor space was not an issue but its use was. Bidet, Toilet, ridiculously large sink (so big you could hardly fit between it and the toilet) a tiny shower and no bath. I have heard that bathrooms in Italy can be small and this came in that bracket quite comfortably! Did it all work? Bidet-unused (tho may have faired better in there than the shower!), Toilet-no issue, Sink-ages to drain and Shower-pure rubbish. Shower head flopped on last but one day smashing soap dish and would never maintain its desired position again. Reported this to no avail...but we were leaving the next day! Several time the water pressure (hot) was very poor. So in all, yes we remained clean, but it was a struggle and the bathroom was the worst I'd seen in many a year. Dated does not come close. The location of the hotel is great for gettin about. 10 minutes walk (15 with cases!) to the main Termin Train station. Less than 5 minutes to the nearest Metro station at Republica on the A Line (the one that goes to all the tourist spots). If you don't mind the walking, about 20 mins to Trevi Fountain, Coloseum, 30 to Pantheon and 1hr to St Pieter's. But the Termini area is not the best so do not venture past there, otherwise the area around the hotel is ok. No names but do not fall into the trap of recommends for restaurants. We think we did, we paid 90 Euros for an avearage meal of 2 course each +1 bottle of wine! Other nights were around 60 Euros. Babbo's was the best meal, tho Life ran it close! Just be aware of hidden charges. Breakfast was ok, nothing brilliant but something for everyone. The staff were always corteous and helpfull. Their best advice being how to return to Ciampino Airport. Use the Terravision Coach service, 8 Euros each, taxi would be 32-45 Euros, metro/train or train/bus cheaper but you have to change. So a great location, pleasent & helpfull staff, noisey room (but I think just about every room in Rome has to be that!), awful bathroom but comfy bed in a clean room. Certainly not the Ritz and could be made better but comfortable enough for our 4 nights

Reviews.Title: “I think this is such a perfect hotel for staying in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingBGs
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Bellesuite twice, and once at the connected sister hotel, Hotel Adler. Both are absolute gems. * Great location - walking distance to trevi fountain / spanish steps area * 5 minute walk to repubblica metro stop * Small side street so pretty quiet * Cute, nice rooms (bathroom and shower small but this is normal in italy) * Good breakfast (by italy standards) * Really nice, friendly staff All that for a very very reasonable price = *great* value. If you going to rome I would definitely consider either Bellesuite or Adler.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in rome....”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaVinnie
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Adler/Bellesuite Hotel in Rome. I would not want to stay anywhere else. All of the staff, Bruno, Alessandro, MIchaelangelo and Martin go above and beyond to make your stay wonderful. Breakfast and the wonderful cappucino were great every morning. Our room was always clean and the staff was always so helpful in recommending places to eat, arranging for airport transportation, etc. I find the Adler to be a "home away from home."

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful. Disorganised, Poor Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RichmondBridge
Reviews.Content: What ever earned this hotel its rating on TripAdvisor is long gone. We experienced blocked plumbing for several days, No hot water for 1 whole day, very low water pressure (i.e. no water coming out the shower) and the shower head was held on the wall by a piece of string (which didnt work BTW). Breakfast was a shambles, everyone was complaining because there were no plates, cutlery, bread (for toast) and cold coffee (We didn't bother with it in the end). I can see how this might have been good a few years ago - but its gone to the dogs since. I suggest you move on to the new highly ranked hotels - this one was the worst of our 6 week holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Patricia255093
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Bellesuite on 4 separate occasions between 3/8 and 7/9. Location is perfect - one street back from via Nazionale, 2 minutes from Piazza della Republica and within easy walking distance of Termini Station. Each stay was in a different room and other that a couple of minor problems I found the rooms to be very clean, spacious, comfortableand quiet. Breakfast was adequate although I did miss not having juice. The staff - Sandro, Bruno and another male (name unknown) were fantastic. Nothing was too much for them to ensure my stay was as pleasant as possible. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: BBuddy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome after a cruise on the Med. and stayed for 3 nights at the Bellesuite. They did offer a car service for 60 euros that picked us up from the airport. The check in desk is on the 2 second floor (actually 3 floor up) and there is a old style lift however only 2 people can fit or 1 person with luggage. The room we stayed in was on the 3 floor (or 4 floors up). I was very disappointed that this hotel did not offer wifi service but offered a computer that seemed to be always used. Our room was large for a European sized room. The air conditioner hardly worked. It was at the lowest setting possible and it did not cool down the room even with the shutters closed and the drapes drawn. This was most unpleasant since the temperatures outside were quite high and we need a place to cool down. When you can't even go into your room to cool down there is a problem. The 2nd floor reception area was cool and the air conditioner here seemed to work just fine (of course this is where the front desk clerk stayed). The towels in the bathroom were very thin and thread bare. On our last night we had to call down because housekeeping only left 1 bath towel for two of us. The lights in the room were also horrible. It was impossible to read anything with the lighting provided. I usually had to go into the bathroom with a maginfying glass to read a map, this was consistent throughout the hotel. They must be using energy efficient bulbs that kept everything extremely dark. The bed was very low to the ground and we usually woke up with back pains from the mattress. The helpfulness of the front desk was spotty. There was one outstanding clerk who was extremely helpful in helping us find the right bus to get to our destination. The rest of the clerks usually gave us one word answers, this could have been a language problem but this particular clerk was not very friendly at all. The breakfast provided by the hotel consisted of pizza, some thin ham, lots of sweet pasteries and yougurt. There was very little protein available. Only on one day was there someone there to make coffee. usually we had to ask the front desk clerk who was very slow and usually finished the coffee when our breakfast was already finished. I would probably try another hotel if I return to Rome. While the location was good, the lighting, lack of wifi and terrible air conditioning were big problems.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pilotlyter
Reviews.Content: we came here for just three nights in August but it was truly wonderful - not expensive and an incredibly helpful staff - could not have been nicer. i'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: weluckyfew
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon in Rome,We had an amazing time,the location of the hotel was perfect as it bordered on the ancient part of the city with a short walk to the Colosseum and the Unknown Soldiers tomb as well as more. The Hotel was very clean,the room was great and the service second to none.The bar terrace was a great place to relax even though you are surrounded by other buldings which only added to the charm of Rome and this hotel.A beautiul city and worth a return trip time and time again.Thank you again to the staff of bellesuite for making our honeymoon a memorable and beautiful moment.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: DaveOrinda_CA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adler was very convenient if you arrive by train from the airport and it was located near all the sites you might want to visit. Allesandro, Bruno and the lovely lady who served breakfast as well as the evening front desk staff didn't hesitate to help with any question or suggestion about a restaurant or a lovely concert at the nearby St Mark's church in the evening. The terrace was a plus for breakfast or anytime after sightseeing to relax and enjoy. The Metro stop was only a block away or it was easy to walk to most sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: YoungFamily27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the metro and the main train station. You can walk to most of the tourist attractions in Rome. The hotel is clean and the staff are all very helpful. The breakfast was served on the outdoor patio - continental breakfast only. Free internet which is fast. Would recommend this hotel for families - we had a king bed plus 2 single beds in our room. Great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: S_Siow
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after it came highly recommended in Tripadvisor. We were warmly greeted by Alessandro upon arrival and I must say, our room was spacious and beautifully furnished. As we planned to explore Rome by foot, I must say this hotel is very convenient as it is close to the train station and most tourist locations. If you're adventurous like us, I'd recommend exploring Rome by foot all the way to Vatican City and back!! The hotel is close by to many good eateries. We especially loved Target restaurant around the corner (not part of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgt99
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by friends to me and I recommend it also. Comfortable, breakfast included and a central location. Beer on the terrace after a siesta and before going out to dinner just perfect! Very friendly staff. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: bobbyrs
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from spending four nights in Rome and I can only echo what previous reviewers have said- this is a very good hotel: the staff are friendly, the room's clean and a good size, great bathrooms and located a few minutes walk from the Termini station (handy for trains and buses). The main sites of Rome are also within easy walking distance. When i go back to Rome i will definitely be staying here again. The only thing to watch out for is finding the hotel in the first place- there is only a small brass name plate at a door which looks like a private residence. You could easily walk past it- reception is on the second floor of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: dred_pirate
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Bellesuite for 4 nights. Whie it's a little far from Termini to walk with luggage, it's well located only one metro stop away. The room was large, the shower wonderful. Breakfast was good, with excellent cappucino. The staff was friendly and responsive. Apparently the rooms are larger than one mignt expect in an Italian hotel. There is wireless internet, and if you don't have a computer, use of a communal computer with your own password to enter the network. All in all, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and great service”
Reviews.Author: DMM104
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bellesuite for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon. We were given a box of chocolates and a bottle of wine, which I thought was a thoughtful touch. The room was spacious and had enough room for both of our luggage bags to fit and not be in the way. There was also alot of drawer and closet space. The hotel is located on a small street which could be a bit noisy, but it's Rome and I imagine it could be alot noisier at other hotels. The only thing weren't 100 percent on was the size of the shower. It has one of those half glass walls and the floor usually got wet. Bruno, Alessandro and Sara were great hosts, very hospitable. They made us feel very welcome and we went back to Rome, we'd love to go back to Bellesuite. The location was walking distance from Termini and all other sites, a very nice location. Breakfast had a nice selection of prosciutto, cheese, croissants/breads, cereal, yogurt and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: soxfan17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Adler, one floor below Bellesuite Hotel. Our double room was clean and a decent size, but the shower stall was a bit small. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and thoughtful. We were given a bottle of wine as a honeymoon gift! The location near the train station was convenient for our first night in Rome, before we headed to Florence. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem! A relaxing, comfortable respite in Roma.”
Reviews.Author: basteca
Reviews.Content: I can’t say enough about how wonderful our stay was at the Bellesuite Roma. My finance and I arrived in Rome via the train from Termini station and attempted to walk with luggage to Via Modena, because it didn’t look too far on the map. The distance wasn’t the issue—it was just disorienting to emerge in this busy busting city where the street names are only visible on the sides of buildings. I recommend you take a cab! On the walk, it began to POUR! We were soaked and lost, but we finally arrived at the Hotel Adler and were greeted by the nicest concierge ever (he spoke great English, too). We told him our story and that we were a newly engaged couple (my finance proposed in Florence at the top of the Duomo!) and he upgraded us to the Bellesuite Roma, which was located on a different floor of the same building at 5 Via Modena. What a pleasant surprise! Our room was cozy but beautiful. We had very high ceilings with beautiful molding and large window that looked out on the street. The window had a metal shutter that you could slide down at night to dampen noise from the street, but Via Modena is fairly quiet and we didn’t have any problems sleeping. The hotel is a little louder at night from internal noises because the old construction lets you hear a door shut across the hall, for example. The parquet floors and marble in bathroom were also nice additions. Size-wise, I found the room to be much better laid out and bigger-feeling that any hotel room I’ve stayed in Europe before. The furniture was arranged in a way to make it feel more spacious, and the high ceiling contributed to the comfortable feel. The bathroom was small, as you’d expect in any European hotel room, but there was a full tub which was a nice addition. The shower setup was kind of uncomfortable—the shower head was one of the detachable kinds on a hose which isn’t my favorite for taking a relaxing shower. The amenities were great: good hairdryer (it was in the desk drawer), SKY satellite TV with plenty of music and English channels, in-room safe, a full length mirror, and a side table and chair (rare in tiny hotel rooms!) The business center is also on this floor—beware of the spring breakers on Facebook, though. We had to wait quite a while to get on the computer access of people checking Facebook. I can’t complain though—free internet access is a nice treat. The bed was a king made of two pushed together twin mattresses, and there weren’t any extra pillows. The breakfast is nothing special (cold, dry, croissants, and weak coffee in a tiny room). I am glad we didn’t pay extra for this and I don’t recommend other travelers do either. The location is fine, but it’s a bit of a walk to the historic center down Via Nazionale. This street is big and brightly lit: it felt very safe even when we walked down it at night. I would have probably liked to be closer in to the center, but this hotel was such a deal that the walk was a small price to pay. There is a McDonalds on the corner with Via Nazionale which is great for a midnight snack if you’re too exhausted to search for a cultural experience! Overall, I totally recommend this hotel. We always felt safe and comfortable here, the staff is friendly, and it was a wonderful respite from hectic days in Rome. I can’t imagine how you could have a better experience at this price point—don’t let the 2 stars fool you!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Bellesuite Rome!”
Reviews.Author: genuinejen
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Bellesuite. The staff, Alessandro and Bruno could not be sweeter and more helpful and the rooms were very clean, spacious and quieter than I expected. The bathroom in the room was very small but was sufficient for a few nights. The location was very good as it was very close to the subway and buses and we were able to get to most places on foot. Breakfast was very basic but the pastries were fresh and the cappuccino each morning was delicious. When the restaurants we had hoped to visit were booked, Bruno made an incredible recommendation to a local spot that was one of the best meals we had in all of Italy. Overall, we had a great stay and thought it was very good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely believe all the hype!”
Reviews.Author: stace11
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at Bellesuite for four nights in November. We were assigned room 303 (someone else has posted pictures and the room looks exactly the same, except the beds were separated for us). It was a cozy room with a large bathroom, which perfectly met our needs. This was our first trip to Rome and we had a difficult time finding the "perfect hotel," but our decision on Bellesuite was the right one. We would not hesitate to return. We were greeted by Alessandro upon arrival. Since our room was not ready yet, he offered to store our luggage for us, then gave us some maps and directions to the hop-on, hop-off bus and we were off. When we came back, our room was not only ready, but Alessandro had moved our luggage into the room for us! This was an unexpected bonus and much appreciated since we each had two large suitcases (we were headed off on a two week cruise after our stay). The room was very quiet and we both slept great. Breakfast in the morning was very pleasant and the cappuccino was the best we had on the entire trip! The location of the hotel is excellent. Literally around the corner from the Repubblica subway station and within walking distance of the Termini station. We had heard not to stay near Termini, but Bellesuite is in an excellent location, far enough away from the gritty parts near the train station. We ate dinner one night at the Target restaurant on the bottom floor of the building. It was very good and was fairly crowded. We were very pleased with our choice. There is satellite TV, so there are some English channels and there is free WIFI in the rooms, as well as a computer for guests' use in the lobby. But, truly, the staff are who made our stay so enjoyable. Alessandro and Bruno were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL, STAFF AND LOCATION IN ROME!”
Reviews.Author: oobellamariuchoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Belle Suites for 6 nights in Rome in February 2010. After researching the many hotels in Rome, I couldnt be happier with the selection we made! Belle Suites is the perfect hotel for anyone staying in Rome. It is in the center of everything!!! Not to mention the staff is so nice, the rooms are spotless and the breakfast is great!

Reviews.Title: “Don´t be fooled by the star ratings in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Destiny2K8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after christmas after staying in a four star hotel that was terrible. The service and staff were excellent. I´d love to keep this hotel a secret so that it doesn´t get filled each time I want to use it but that wouldnt be fair. The rooms can be classified as 4 star, breakfast is simple and good and usually included in the price. There is a free internet service. Its in a great location within walking distance to Termini and the staff really try to make you feel at home. Also, the rooms have DVD players and films can be borrowed from reception free of charge. I really felt content and comfortable, I´ll definitely visit again. Well done Alessandro and staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Ipoxy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the Termini central station in a shared building with some other hotels. The staff was impeccable, friendly and very helpful. They offer DVDs for their guests and internet is free of charge to use in the hallway. The breakfast was wonderfully served on the balcony and was very good. They offer you a homemade coffee of your choise which was excelent. The rooms were decent in size and had a very good standard. If you are visiting historical Rome like Colosseum, Forum and the Vatican I would recommend a hotel closer to these attractions, and I also belive that you can save some money on other hotels but not with the same standard as this one. We stayed for one night and left very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: UTinEurope
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a total of 4 nights with Bellesuite. Must say that service (Alessandro) was great; he spoke great english and got us any information we were looking for (even a bottle of wine and chocolates waiting for us on our anniversary!). The location is ideal.. 2 minute walk to the metro (literally around the corner), which is one stop away from the termin, or 10 minute walk to the termini. The hotel backs up to a ton of great shops on Via Nazionale with great shopping and amazing restaurants. The Trevi Fountain is certainly a do-able walk (maybe 15 minutes). Overall the experience was great, but we were a little disappointed with the size of the rooms, as well as the stiffness of the bed (felt like lying on cardboard). I had read on Trip Advisor to ask for one of the "larger" rooms which we definently did not receive. Our trip was broken up in between when we went to venice for the weekend and returned for one last night at Bellesuite where we ask if we could possibly have a different (bigger) room for the last night. We were told the hotel was completely booked and we got the same room (even though it was off season and we didnt see a soul the entire time we were there. At 88 EUR a night I highly recommend Bellesuite!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice choice”
Reviews.Author: ljr88888
Reviews.Content: Very attractive room ... large bathroom ... convenient location only a 10-minute walk from Termini Station. Alessandro was kind enough to chat with us as we had a glass of wine on the terrace ... even though he was busy manning the reception desk. Had to catch a train early so did not get to try the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen-McT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is up a side street and was clean and comfortable. It was near enough all the main attractions of Rome to walk and we also walked from Termini with our luggage in about 10 minutes. Alessandro is welcoming and recommended and made a reservation for us at a lovely restaurant we would never have come across. All in all thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “you will never regret choosing this hotel”
Reviews.Author: moreti44
Reviews.Content: What an experience. The hotel, the location the rooms and especially the staff Unbelievable efforts to satisfy the client. This really is my place in Rome

Reviews.Title: “A great welcome to Roma”
Reviews.Author: Drroma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 days at Hotel Adler, Bellesuite Roma. We were comfortable and had the personel attention advertised. Alessandro and his team were continuously helpful and Alessandro personally assisted in directing us around Rome. Even a 3 am exit for the airport was handled perfectly. We felt welcomed and appreciated. This will be our return hotel of choice without any doubt. Finally, the location was perfect for either extensive walking or the Metro. The only cab we took was to the airport. Alessandro, family, and team, thank you for welcoming us to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PlanmanVancouver
Reviews.Content: Bellesuite was a great find for our first trip to Rome - another Tripadvisor success story. The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing, with easy access to Termini Station and to public transportation. The hotel is on a side street, so there is little traffic noise - we didn't use the electric shutter overnight, as we didn't feel we needed it. Our room (we stayed in Room 301) was nicely decorated and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was not huge (it's Europe, after all), but was attractive and in great condition. We enjoyed breakfast on the terrace each morning and found it to be just the right way to start the day. The free internet station in the hallway was a great convenience that we used several times. What really set Bellesuite apart however was the helpfulness of the staff and the sense that people really cared about our comfort. Alessandro, Bruno, Martin, and all the staff were very accommodating - particularly in suggesting restaurants and making reservations. We found Bellesuite to be very good value, and hope to return soon to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the best service”
Reviews.Author: MarilynM
Reviews.Content: Access to public transportation excellent. Rooms are spotless and comfortable. Even though it is in a busy area, with the shutters down you have very little road noise. European handheld shower always interesting to deal with. Breakfast just right. The staff was always there to help with any requests, from museum tickets to restaurant recommendations and reservations. A real value in a high price city.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, great price”
Reviews.Author: viru1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Alder, it close from the main train station and the metro lines. You can walk to Trevy Fountain and the staff is very friendly and staffed 24 hours. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: js100807
Reviews.Content: Alessandro was incredible. Not only did he help us navigate our way around Rome, he got us reservations for the museums we were going to visit in Florence two days later! The hotel was very clean and our room was perfect. I would highly recommend this place to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: VikesAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I greatly enjoyed our stay in Rome. The folks at Bellesuites were very helpful. We needed to secure train tickets to Florence and the team at Bellesuites made sure we got our tickets on time for our trip. Very clean and comfortable rooms, in a great location to catch the trains and/or subway. We would highly recommend the hotel to our friends. Thanks Dave and Beth Austin Texas

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: weezytravelbug
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent (Alessandro!) The location was within walking distance of many good restaurants, the train station, and everything we wanted to see, although hoofing it to and from Vatican City was a long walk; we'd recommend a cab or bus for that distance. The rooms were not small, but were full of furniture, since we had seven people in two rooms; crowded but economical. The hotel is spotlessly clean and breakfast, though simple continental, was delicious. Cappucino! There were initially issues with our transfer from the airport, which, while included in our hotel fee, had not been properly arranged. Although we ended up having to pay for our transfer, the hotel stood by their deal and refunded us the full amount of the transfer. How often would you expect that to happen? We have already recommended this hotel to other friends traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,wise choice”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSmiths
Reviews.Content: Ths hotel was an excellent choice. Great room, modern, clean, unbelievable English TV choices, very cooperative staff, good location, convenient to train station. Strong recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MomWithTwoTeenagers
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome for a week with my two teenage children. The Bellesuite Rome hotel exceeded our expectations. It was clean, quiet and on a wonderfully quaint side street. We walked to all of the sites, even the Vatican (maybe 45 min walk?). Breakfast of granola cereal, yogurt, breads/pastries and cappuccino was enjoyed every day on the covered terrace. Just lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice and central”
Reviews.Author: mryynane
Reviews.Content: The rooms were stylish and very pleasant. The location is excellent on a side street with metro and bus connections nearby. Breakfast was ok on a nice terrace. Staff was friendly. Good value for money and would definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Bellesuite Rome is a beautiful hotel with personal, first class service”
Reviews.Author: stevieleanei
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with excellent service. I had a great experience staying here. The rooms are simple yet elegant and clean. Alessandro, the hotel's Concierge, was friendly and extremely helpful. We were well taken care of here and I will definately stay here again on the next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected surprise!”
Reviews.Author: walker_hannah
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting too much from Hotel Adler because we were paying less than we had seen other hotels charging, but we were pleasantly surprised by the large, clean and comfortable room we were offered. The location is very good. It's in a bustling area, but because the windows all have shutters you can close, it's not noisy at night and easy to sleep in. We were traveling with an infant and the hotel provided a cot for us...though the bed was large enough for the baby to sleep between us comfortably. Breakfast wasn't anything spectacular, but there is a super friendly waiter who offers to make you a fresh cappuccino as soon as he greets you.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay to see everything in rome”
Reviews.Author: melisande1
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay at this hotel. just as terrific as the first time. helpful staff. pleasant breakfast. comfortable room with satellite tv. (know that the whole thing can be put into language of origin for all the english shows - had to ask for the desk to do it). comfy beds, big room. and the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Kanaka_Kim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best of the ones we stayed in during our trip to Europe. It is spotless, historic with its marble floor and steps, and well situated to historic sites and local transportation. Some excellent restaurants are located within one minute's walk. The service is instant and cheerful. The breakfast is wonderful. I came with fifteen family members and they were very accomodating even with some young children. So what's the drawbacks? They were never able to get my laptop to work with the wifi during the whole time (five days) I was here. I think they have some type of firewall that blocks out certain computers. All the other hotels in Europe had no problem with this. Our bodet never functioned well, but this is a very minor problem as we don't even know how to use it. That's it. Overall, it was an excellent hotel for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LolaSasa
Reviews.Content: Stop looking for a hotel in Rome and stay here. The location is excellent and you can walk to most cite within 15 minutes. The hotel is close to the train station, subway station, grocery stores, and lots of restaurants and just about anything you need. The staff goes above and beyond. They are friendly and more than willing to help you with anything. They greet you each morning in the lovely breakfast terrace with cappuccino, fantastic way to start your day in Roma. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, lovely…..since this was our honeymoon, staff and management sent as chocolate and bottle of wine with compliments……very sweet of them!!! This is our home away from home…….we will come again in Bellesuite Roma and highly recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Ana071
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quite good, large and clean. The hotel is well-located, very close to one of the main streets in Rome. Breakfast is also quite good and the staff is nice and helpful. You really pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “great location, rooms OK”
Reviews.Author: baldmongoose
Reviews.Content: Close enough to Termini to walk, lots of restaurants near by, excellecent service, room (and especially bathroom and shower) were small.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussietriptraveller
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel at the start of 6 weeks in Italy. We enjoyed our stay. On reflection after the six weeks, this hotel was one of the best stays we had. Comfortable rooms, clean. Downstairs to the Adler for breakfast which was quite good, cappuccinos excellent, staff friendly. Easy to reach from the Termini, even with big bags. Many points of interest easy to access on foot from here, train for the Vatican, from the Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Adler is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: paulchonko
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adler is a great place to stay. The rooms are clean and quiet and the service there was great. They answered any questions and provided any additional services requested. I would defintiely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In busy, hectic Rome, it's nice to come "home" to this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: makaha22
Reviews.Content: Welcoming and helpful are words that come to mind after our stay at Bellesuite/Adler Hotel. The location close to the train/bus station allowed us to walk to the hotel, yet hop on a bus to historic sights when walking is not an option. The internet access was helpful, including being allowed to print boarding passes for our return flight home. The patio was a cool spot to relax after a hot afternoon of sightseeing. Having a mini fridge in the room was a great addition added to the comfort of the clean rooms. Closeby, budget friendly, takeout food shops allow for a casual meal option. The Hotel staff has been together many years, which adds to the efficiency.

Reviews.Title: “A very worthwhile experience”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaVinnie
Reviews.Content: The Adler Hotel was far superior than what we expected. The service, particularly "Bruno" was outstanding. The breakfast far exceeded our expectations. Everyone was polite, helpful and made our stay very comfortable. I would definately come back there on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Lovely Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sandura
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in April 2009. The Hotel has everything we needed. Great location, nice rooms and GREAT staff. We had a very clean modern room which was spacious with a small clean bathroom. The breakfast was good to start your day. One good feature that they have free internet. We would definitely come again and we highly recommended!!! Thank You Bellsesuite for the lovely Stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Loirinha
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much for the pleasant stay at Bellesuite. The hotel has everything we needed. Good location, nice rooms,good service. Only the breakfast could improve having some more fruits or natural juices. The rooms facing the main street are a bit noisy, but that is the price we pay to be in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and caring staff”
Reviews.Author: kseshe
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in BelleSuite in January 2009 for 9 days. The hotel has a really great location: almost all places of interest are reachable on foot (maximum in a half an hour walk). It is very easy to get there from the main railway station of Roma – Termini Station as well. The staff was very caring and ready to render their assistance at any time. The breakfast was hearty, unlike the one you traditionally get in the most of Italian hotels. The magnificent cappuccino that Bruno (concierge) was preparing in the mornings must be noted especially. The advices of Alessando (the other concierge) were very helpful on our way to the suburbs. We shall definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Travelfanman
Reviews.Content: I partner and I stayed here for four nights in December 2008. The building has a few hotels, it seems to be one on each floor. The reception is on the second floor, just next to the breakfast room. Our bedroom was upstairs (third floor). The room itself was fine, and the bathroom was basic but clean and functional. The location of the hotel is good. There are several restaurants within five minutes walking distance, although they are a little more expensive. The hotel is less than five minutes from your room to Piazza Republica metro stop. Also buses run along Via Nazionale very frequently so you can get about easily. Overall, I would return and stay at this hotel. If you are considering staying here make sure you get a good deal, otherwise stay elsewhere for cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nosiy, bug infested hotel in a state of disrepair”
Reviews.Author: chickles
Reviews.Content: Based on the good reviews the Bellesuite had received here on tripadvisor.com, my husband and I decided to stay at this hotel during our honeymoon. Unfortunately, this was a MAJOR mistake. After requesting a quiet room, they put us in a room that was 30 feet away from Via Modena, which is a major street. The windows didn't shut, so it was very noisy… not at all what we requested. There were also tons of mosquitoes in the room, the sink didn't drain in the bathroom, and the shower was broken. Please see my attached pictures. We asked for another room, but the only other available room was directly next door, where the windows shut just as poorly as the first room. Finally, after hours of complaining, they put us into a new room that was on the inside of the building, but in a totally different hotel completely (the Adler Hotel), which is just one floor below the Bellesuite. This room was very small and barely could fit the bed in the room with more than 2 feet to walk in around two sides of the bed. There was a small wardrobe with no safe (nor was there a hotel safe), no deadbolts on the door, and more mosquitoes. We got ready for bed and found the only trashcan in the room did not open and the bed was actually two beds of different heights pushed together. AND there were holes in the sheets. After one night, we knew we couldn't stay there any longer, so they said they would give us a refund and then we found a nice new hotel. However, our travel agent who booked this hotel for us emailed them NINE times. They claimed our credit card would not accept their refund attempts. Our credit card company had no records of this occurring. At one point, the Bellesuite management asked us for our personal bank account number so they could directly put the money into our account. That is just asking for identity theft to occur. We had to open a new bank account to get the money bank. In the end, it took them TWO MONTHS to get us our refund. It is very clear to us that the Bellesuite writes the majority of their own reviews themselves here on tripadvisor.com, as much of their business is derived from this website. Do not be fooled by what the other reviews say. Do not stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kikizzy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to termini station but we found it a bit too far to walk across a very big, busy intersection. The metro station is only 2 mins walk around the corner and 1 stop away from termini (very easy to use).Our room was at back of hotel so not noisy. Bathroom was really modern and small but you must expect this in most European cities.We thought breakfast was fantastic as we had come from Amalfi where all you got was 1 croissant and coffee. Desk clerk was extremely helpful. Great Italian restaurant called Target? downstairs and around the corner. Ver clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location ace, accomodation average”
Reviews.Author: Claire_murray
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this BelleSuite and whilst the hotel is comfortable the experiance wasn't brilliant. The hotels location is OK, its close to the Metro and bus stops. However with this comes from road noise which in Rome isn't that surprising as the traffic is awful. The room whilst comfortable was supposed to be non smoking but someone had not read the notices. The bathroom only had one plug which got stuck in the bath and had to wait 7 hours for someone to free. So had the lovely experiance of cold water in the bath overnight. Although the room had additional tissues and toilet rolls when we arrived by the second night these had disappeared. Unfortunately we ran out of both during that night. The breakfast left a lot of be desired. There was only a very limited choice which ran out if you arrived after 8:30 for breakfast. Although the hotel is clean and the staff were friendly I was not impressed by the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service!”
Reviews.Author: GreeceCruise
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and Service... Team very helpful with directions and information...

Reviews.Title: “a small oasis in rome”
Reviews.Author: pic77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bellesuite Rome few days in this august. It's a fabulous tiny hotel in the center of rome. You can enjoy quiet and relaxing atmosphere though it's just off Nazionale street. The rooms were nice and clean. I found so unique to have a breakfast at their balcony with a fountain. The staff was so friendly and helpful to arrange for me a pick up service at the airport, train tickets, restaurants, etc... I really had a great time there and would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: scarg0
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a positive experience at this hotel. The scenery is beautiful, the staff was kind, the rooms were well-equipped, and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: towsonnc
Reviews.Content: Bellesuite is a clean hotel that represents good value in a city like Rome where good hotels are very hard to find. I stayed at Bellesuite on two separate occasions over a one week period in late May. I had the opportunity to see three different rooms as we had friends traveling with us during the first part of our stay. Some things to point out: 1. the service is good and employees are friendly even with broken english some of the time. 2. most rooms face the street and are thus somewhat noisy (average for any big city), however room 303 is on the interior and is much quieter. i stayed in 302 and 304 - both had double beds but were just twins pushed together. 304 has a very small shower - you can barely turn yourself around in so be advised, you might prefer a different room if possible. 3. breakfast is more than sufficient with croissants, cereal, juice, etc offered at no charge. 4. internet is free and easily accessible 24 hours a day. 5. location is good - only 5-10 min walk from Termini. located a block off of Via Nationale which provides access to bus line and a block from the Repubblica metro stop which provides access to subways. If you're looking for a clean hotel that is relatively cheap in Rome, this is not a bad choice. The pictures on their website reflect the hotel properly. It's probably a 3 star, possibly 4 on US standards.

Reviews.Title: “Met All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BelleSuite for 3 nights 4/21 to 4/24. The hotel met or exceeded all expectations. The room was clean and well maintained. Bathroom a tad small with the odd set up as mentioned in other reviews Close to bus and metro at Piazza Republicca and not too far from Termini. (We thought too far to walk with our bags to pick up rental car—Taxi was 10 euros with tip, extra charge for extra bags (2 large suitcases, 2 tote bags, 2 smaller backpacks.) Hotel shares building with some commercial businesses and other hotels. (See picture of entry.) On quiet side street with limited traffic noise especially with outside shutters lowered. Breakfast has ham, salami, and cheese in addition to the breads and pastries. I especially like the Nutella with Orange Marmalade! Cappuccino and espresso very good. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 122309d
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend break in February. While it is located near to metro stations we felt that everywhere was walkable to the hotel. The layout of the hotel is a little disjointed but this infact made it feel like we were staying in our own apartment. The rooms were spacious and clean. The windows had electric shutters which shut out most of the noise from the street. One tip for Rome, book your trip to the vatican prior to going as the queues can last for hours even if you get up early! Also the pantheon is an absolute must!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: kirbycooper
Reviews.Content: I had no idea where to start when looking for a modern, affordable hotel in Rome. I trawled through pages and pages on Trip advisor and came across this beauty! This hotel was perfect, the location was spot on. 10-15 minutes' walk from Trevi fountain, Colosseum etc. Train station was 5 minutes away, but on the better side of town - Never felt threatened in this area at all. Got a taxi from the Airport as it was late, but it's easy to find so you could get the bus (Terravision bus for 8 euros) or train. Its only downfall is that it's not very easily spotted from the street, you have to ring a buzzer but it's always answered quickly - don't let that put you off. If you get a taxi, they'll call the buzzer for you. The price was good, cheapest I'd found by a long way - I was after something modern and enjoyable. The hotel made the holiday even better. Staff were excellent, very helpful and polite. The rooms were great, no complaints whatsoever. breakfast was included and delicious. There are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Nisse73
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel i central Rome and found the BelleSuite Rome on Tripadvisor and decided to book it based on the reviews on the site. We were not disappointed. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and we really liked it. The hotel is nice and quiet and consists of two wings on two floors in the building. The staff was friendly and attentive and the hotel has quite a good breakfast as well. The rooms seems to have been refurbished quite recently and are clean and very nice. Our room had a very high ceiling which gave the room a nice airy feel. The bathroom was quite small, but nice and clean. One thing to note though, is that the beds are quite hard. The hotel can be a bit hard to find, since there is only a small sign on the side of the door, we actually passed it once without noticing it when we were looking for the correct street number.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located quaint little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aviator26
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near Piazza della Repubblica, but not in conspicuous location. Within walking distance to all the major sites (except maybe the Vatican). Breakfast was quite good. Sky satellite television. Comfortable bed. Bathroom was nice, but three-tier floor caused some late-night stumbling. Staff was excellent--very nice and English speaking. Staff recommended a wonderful wine shop nearby--be sure to ask! Free internet access--not just wiFi, but a computer & printer! Quiet. Great restaurant (Target) right on the corner. Price was very reasonable, especially for Rome. Negatives? On third floor, but a small elevator is available.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with good location.”
Reviews.Author: Tacoma_Gritty
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with a 5 minute walk from the Termini station. We loved the staff who spoke English very well and gave us good information about the area. The breakfast that was included, was the perfect start to our day and the hotel was close to many other restaurants for lunch and dinner. BelleSuite was a little difficult to see from the street, but once you we're buzzed in and on your way up the old lift, the hotel was very clean and secure. We'll visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at the BelleSuite”
Reviews.Author: Pilgrimgreen
Reviews.Content: Just back from a two night stay at the BelleSuite - really enjoyed it. On the whole, the report is very positive - it is central (a few minutes from the tube and about 5 mins from Termini), it is quiet, and we couldn't fault the room - comfortable, clean and safe. The only downside was that we had to ring the bell every evening to get back in through the main front door, which felt a little awkward (being English...) when we came back late. That aside, can't fault the place. Loved the lift! Rome on the whole provides a perfect weekend break - particularly when you combine it with a rugby match!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: yldwest
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at BelleSuites. The location was great- a metro stop was less than 5 mins walk...shopping & restaurants were right around the corner as well. Alessandro & Bruno were always very friendly & helpful. Alessandro booked tickets on the Eurostar for us to Florence & had them waiting for us upon our arrival. Bruno made us a mean cappuccino every morning & even brought a tray up for us one morning even though it was past 10am & breakfast was over. Free internet in the hall outside the rooms was very convenient & a nice amenity. We were there 4 nights & had no complaints...we would definitely recommend this hotel & would stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ndm77
Reviews.Content: A great deal in a great part of town. We flew into Milan and had no hotel picked for the next 3 days which we were spending in Rome. I had read the good reviews of Belle Suites on here, so I booked it through Venere.com and got a rate of 90Euros/night (google 'venere.com coupon code to get a 4% off code which saves 15E). The hotel is accessed off a side street 1 block away from the repubblica station, and is within walking distance (though we did not walk it) from the main Termini station. The front desk clerks are very helpful and friendly, they brought us and our bags up to the room and showed us all the amenities (refrigerator with room for things of your own-hit the grocery 4 blocks down Nazionale for drinks and snacks). The bed was comfortable, but not great. Bathroom was clean and stylish, the furniture was modern- dark wood and an LCD TV with DVD player and Sky digital cable box. AC/Heat worked perfectly and we were never too warm or cold. There is a metal blind that keeps out all light, so beware of sleeping really late if you keep it down at night. Breakfast is included and there is a nice spread including pastries, cereal, danishes, and yogurt with juices, regular coffee and some excellent cappuccinos that they will make for you. One morning my wife slept late and I hustled down to get breakfast before 10 (it's served from 7-10). The gentleman working asked where my wife was and then put a tray together for her with food and a cappucino for me to take back up. Location is very good, you are 1 block from the Repubblica stop and a 10-15 minute walk from the Colisseum/Forum, as well as the same distance from the Trevi fountain. If you want to eat at the Target restaurant downstairs (not affiliated with Belle Suites), I recommend making a reservation. We did not, and consequently were taken downstairs to their "second" dining room (in the basement) which paled in comparison to the elegant main room. We got up and left. This hotel is an excellent value, rooms were clean, modern and well-appointed, the location is excellent, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Also, there is a desk area with a computer and free internet. A+++

Reviews.Title: “BelleSuite is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ChicTravelerAlberta
Reviews.Content: The BelleSuite is a fantastic place and a great value for Rome, where hotels are pretty expensive. The first thing that struck me about the hotel is the excellent renovation. The rooms are very modern and look brand-spanking new. It is beautifully appointed - dark floors, high ceilings, modern furniture. The decor in the common areas is gorgeous - all white with marble and great drapes. It has the feel of a luxury hotel without the price tag. It also has amenities like remote controlled blinds and satellite TV - stuff you don't normally find in Europe at this price point. The room we had was also very spacious. The bathroom isn't large, but it is large enough. We never felt cramped. The service at this hotel was great. We often dealt with Michelangelo, who was very helpful and made us cappuccino every morning. We actually had two stays at this hotel over the course of our trip - one towards the beginning and right at the end, before we flew home. BelleSuite welcomed us back and put us in the same room, which was very nice of them. BelleSuite was great and I would be pleased to stay again, anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: BrentD
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel while in Rome. They are doing some remodeling in this building, but it was as pleasant as the first time we stayed last year. Allessandro was so helpful and Bruno was as pleasant as ever. The free internet is a nice touch to stay in commubnication with those at home. For the price of around $180 a night, you can't beat the location , nor the cleanliness of this hotel. Target restaurant below is a must. Nice ambiance and prices are in line. Taxi to FCO from here are around $50 euro. You can take the train from FCO, but prefer taxi's. Enjoy ...as we always do. A nice hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chewpei
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and loved the location. It was only a short 10 minute walk from the Termini train station and the on-off bus tours that start there. And a metro stop is less than 5 minutes away. The staff was very helpful, the breakfast on the terrace was fine (typical European continental breakfast), the free internet was appreciated, it was quiet, with good a/c. My only negative comment is that the walls had some serious scuff marks that probably would have come off with a little scrubbing. It didn't make the best impression, but on closer examination the room was very clean. It was the most expensive hotel on our 16 day trip, and while it wasn't the nicest, it was a good price in a an expensive city. The other hotel on the same floor as the reception desk gave us a more expensive price and didn't look any nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: WolfpackDemonDeacon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BelleSuite for 3 nights during our two week trip to Italy. We found the hotel to be a great value. The price cannot be beat, and the location was excellent. You could walk to most sights, and the train station was close by as well. It was one block from a metro stop. The free internet service was okay....we kept losing a connection every time we used it, but other than this everything was perfect. The breakfast was served on a terrace and consisted of coffee, bread, yogurt, fruit, meats and cheeses, juice, cakes/pastries. Above average selection for Italy. Our room was clean, but small. The bathroom was small but clean as well. The staff was very helpful with recommendations and reservations. We would definitely stay at BelleSuite again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a dirty city”
Reviews.Author: ADRIAN888
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and found it to be a great place to stay for a reasonable price. Rome itself is not a great place to spend much time in as it is noisy, dirty, and the locals are shall we say less than friendly. That aside it is a place that you have to visit atleast once to see things like the Trevi fountain and the Colosseum and when you do go the BelleSuite is a fine place to stay. It is in the same building as Residence Cellini and the two properties are very similar except the BelleSuite is decorated in a more modern fashion. The location is ideal and the main sites are all within esay reach. I would definatly stay here again if I ever drummed up enough enthusiasm and energy to visit Rome but if you want a weekend away enjoying culture and good food then pick Florence before Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It's great - just book it”
Reviews.Author: gallagher
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in Rome City Centre, 10 minutes from Spanish Steps. 3 minutes from Train Station. The best staff we have ever come across. Kind, Friendly, Welcoming, Professional, Gracious - each member of staff are so nice you would think they own the hotel themselves.
