We stayed with 2 children but would recommend it for everyone, young and old. Comfortable beds, Plenty of room for a city centre hotel. Simple Breakfast, Sky TV, ( Sky movies for Euro 5 per day ) Free internet access. Only downfall is the bathroom. Too small and abit cold but we didn't go to Rome to stay in a bathroom ! Excellent Value. Entrance abit strange for a hotel but don't worry - when you step out of the lift ... everything is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarriors
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Belle Suites for three nights . The Belle Suites Hotel was a very pleasent surprise. It has recently been renvoated so the outer common areas were bright fresh and well appointed. The room was a typical European size but was very nice. The rooms had been updated and everything made for a very nice stay. Room had plenty of light for reading,working; the bathroom was a nice size and excellent lighting. Shower "booth" was a little bit of a challenge but worked out fine. Water pressure was excellent. The room was very quite and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast room is shared with their sister property one floor below. The hotel is in a great location to walk to shopping, Spanish Steps, Via Vento and Via Condidti; The hotel is around the corner from Via Nationale where you can find a couple of book stores, small grocery store, transportation, and is walking distance from the trian station (if you don't have much luggage). For the location, the updated style and various attributes, compared to hotels around it, it is a very good deal. Next time I am in Rome, I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the buck!”
Reviews.Author: bcmitaly
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy and I stayed for 3 nights at Belle Suite. I was very satysfied with the room decoration and cleaniness, the friendly staff always available to answer questions and to find specific sights/restaurants. My room had a flat screen TV and good working AC. There was also internet available outside for free. Breakfast was much different than american standards (moslty bread, cheese, pate, juices, croissant, yogurt and coffee) but it was very good. Walking distance to Termini train station, and also to bus stops. I will definetely stay there again next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hav_kids-will_travel
Reviews.Content: Happy to say that last year's Tripadvisior's "Hidden Gem" award was well deserved. My two two daughters and I stayed for two nights and found the triple room crisp, clean, spacious and well-appointed (LCD TV, Sky, DVD); this is all a city hotel should be. It's in a convenient location for all the sights and the railway station, and, being close to the Italian Government's offices, free of the graffitti that plagues much of the city. Although 200 euros a night for a triple room with breakfast means it is not a "budget" hotel, I doubt you'll find better value accommodation or customer service. I should say, however, that if you are a light sleeper or usually sleep in a quiet neighbourhood, the city-noise can be intrusive so do pack some earplugs. In my opinion, the criticism levelled against the breakfasts by some Tripadvisor reports is a little unfair. It's typical Italian (cereals, pastries, cakes, sickly syruppy juices) but it's fresh, plentiful and served up until 10.30 in the morning. NB when you first arrive, the entrance is very inconspiuous; look for a small shoulder-high "Hotel" sign proruding from the wall with "Belle Suite Hotel" one of the buttons beside the adjacent double-doors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at BelleSuite Rome”
Reviews.Author: 2-2-italy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy. Rome was our starting point, with BelleSuite being hotel choice. After using Travel Advisor website to research hotels and locations, my first choice was BelleSuite. I tried booking through Venere.com, but they could not accommodate us for Sept 19 - 21. I found Bellesuite's website, and via email correspondence, booked a double room. As directed, I called with Credit Card information. After arriving from airport via train, we walked to hotel, map in hand. What a wonderful surprise. The hotel is located in an excellent central location. We were tired, having flown from San Franciso, CA. We took the small cage elevator, it comfortably accommodated two adults with small rolling suitcases. Alessandro greeted us upon arrival, showed us to our room, assisting with our luggage. Our eyes lit up as we passed a small area with computer and Alessandro pointed out the free internet, telling us the password to sign in. Our room was wonderful, updated and clean. The breakfast, your basic continental style was okay, not outstanding, but comparable to the other two hotels we stayed. The highlight the first morning was ordering cappuccinos. I absolutely love cappuccinos and would sit, writing in my journal, enjoying two every morning. Three women staying across the hall from us invited us to share their private tour of the Vatican which Alessandro had arranged. We split the cost 180 Euros. Our tour guide was Michele Agostino. We skipped the lines, entered through a side door, with Michele knowing everyone. Michele is very knowledgeable and after the tour, we all agreed it was the best tour we had ever experienced. We agreed it was worth the extra cost. Alessandro split the cost for us, adding it to our individual bills. All we had to do was pay when checking out. I inquired as to how to book 1st Class reservations for the train to Florence. Alessandro said he would take care of it. When we checked out our Train Ticket was waiting for us and had been added to our hotel bill. What service! No worries, Alessandro took care of us. (Our hotel in Florence would not book our train reservations to Venice, requiring us to purchase in person) I checked my email while in Florence and found an email awaiting me from Alessandro and staff at BelleSuite thanking me for choosing them. I will definitely stay at the BelleSuite on my next trip to Rome. The rooms were clean, outstanding, with our window facing a quiet side street. We were not bothered by noise. Location and Customer Service was A+. After visiting the Borghese Museum, we took a cab. The driver looked puzzled when I told her the Hotel and street names. I had my map and showed the cab driver where the hotel was on the map. While she drove, I sat in front directing her! We laughed about it later. Very enjoyable experience, plus we were successful in wandering down side streets, finding the best little restaurants. I highly recommend the BelleSuite. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jverrillo
Reviews.Content: Nice location, large, clean rooms, excellent staff. Very good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelerInOH
Reviews.Content: The BelleSuite is a great little hotel in the heart of Rome. They only have 7 rooms, all on one floor. The reception area is one floor below where the rooms are located, which means that you don’t hear the noises of people checking in and out. Breakfast is included and is OK. The staff is very helpful, although don’t expect bellboys and the like, this is a small hotel that charges very competitive rates. Be sure to ask them for restaurant recommendations – do not just venture out as Rome is extremely touristy and you’ll find that many restaurants prey upon tourists by charging too much for not so good food. The hotel staff recommended several restaurants that matched our price and location preferences and every time they were right on. The location is absolutely wonderful; you’ll be close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Really a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Gentilhomme
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from Rome and stayed in the Belle Suite for 3 nights. We were very pleased---the location was convenient to the Metro, buses, and taxi stand at the Piazza della Republica.....bearing in mind that unlike us spoiled Americans, Europeans think nothing of having to walk 5 minutes! It was spotlessly clean, and the rooms are exceptionally large for a city hotel--we had a king-sized bed and they could've fit 3 more in there. The bathroom is very tiny, though. We loved opening our windows out over the street (Via Torino) and leaning out to enjoy the passing foot, scooter, and car traffic at any time of the day or night...but if you have a low tolerance for city noise, either ask for their quietest room or stay somewhere else! With the windows down and the shutters closed, there is little noise at night, but it is still audible if you're a light sleeper. We stayed in room 304. As everyone else mentioned, the staff is wonderful. The breakfast is very basic--be sure to ask for a capuccino, though, and they'll gladly make it. You won't find a nicer staff in any city--so don't let language fears put you off here. We liked the little birdcage elevator! A little tight when you're first arriving or leaving, but hey, it's got charm. If you go, up on the Piazza della Republica, there are 2 crescent shaped buildings that cover 1/4 each of the outer ring of the piazza. Walking up from the hotel, there is a luxury hotel in the right-hand side, and several shops including a pharmacy on the left hand curve. There is a cafe near the middle that has tables that look out toward the beautiful Naiad fountain....had a fantastic little vanilla milkshake there one afternoon, but we also stopped in for an aperitif, which was good, and even had a light breakfast there one morning. The place is not fancy or cheap, but my other half says their scrambled eggs were the best he's ever eaten! Also a good place to pick up an english-language newspaper if you like....there's a newsstand right nearby. We liked the International Herald-Tribune. Anyway, if you're looking for a little outside place to have a drink right in the neighborhood and with a good view, go take a seat and a waiter will be with you when he gets a minute. Catch your breath and marvel at the rush of Roman life, then pop into the basilica across from you and get a glimpse of the size of the old Roman baths. Betcha traffic wasn't any lighter 2000 years ago! IMPORTANT NOTE! Via Modena is not a large street and cab drivers will typically not know where it is---unless your Italian is good, a better bet is to tell them "Piazza della Republica, per favore", then just walk the few minutes back to the hotel. I STRONGLY SUGGEST that anyone going to Rome factor in at least 20 euros a day for cab fare. Yes, there are buses and the metro running, but boy, it can be a real boost to your flagging energy levels to sometimes just grab a cab and relax while someone else negotiates the crowds! Probably the best money we spent in Rome was on cabs.....after a long day of sightseeing, what a wonderful luxury to spend 10 euros getting home in comfort. Just resting your feet for that 10-15 minutes gave you time to get your second wind! Besides, it's a thrill ride and the scenery is unbeatable. All in all, we were very pleased with the quality we received at the Belle Suite for the price. I think you'd have a hard time finding a nicer place for the money. I highly recommend it.....

Reviews.Title: “Good value with small caveats.”
Reviews.Author: JandApe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bellesuite for a week in September and by and large, would agree with its high rating on Trip Advisor. Our room was well equipped and everything worked perfectly. Yes, the bathroom was small but we didn’t want to hold any parties in there, if you know what I mean? The desk staff were particularly friendly and personable. I also thought it good value for money. There are a few things potential visitors should bear in mind. Not many cab drivers knew of the Bellesuite, I almost always had to ask for via Modena. The Bellesuite is not the only hotel in that building, there are a number of establishments that may, or may not belong to the same owner. Access to the Bellesuite is via a few flights of stairs, or a rather rickety old elevator, (3 persons max). Our room looked out on to the via Torino, near the intersection with the via Nazionale and the traffic noise was quite loud. We are city people, so are used to it but it needs bearing in mind. The breakfasts are also typically Italian hotel standard with barely drinkable ‘regular’ coffee, undrinkable juice and disappointing pastries. I did order espresso on a couple of occasions and was not charged extra. There are some very good cafes in the neighbourhood so we simply ate there. Sounds bad? Well it isn’t, I enjoyed my week in the Bellesuite. It was well situated for public transport and the sights and in my opinion represents very good value for money in Rome. Pep up the breakfast a bit and I would give it full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cornbread35
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Bellesuite recently as the first leg of a 10 day Italy trip. As others have mentioned, while a little tricky to find and not much to look at from the outside, the staff and rooms make for a fine stay. The hotel is well located near a metro stop, but not so near the stop that the Davinci Express from Fuimincino arrives at that one would want to walk with luggage. We took a cab, which ran about 15E. It is a little confusing when you first arrive, as the same bulding has Bellesuite, Alder, Target Inn and an apartment area all though the same main entrance. The staff took very good care of us and the room was very nice. It was good to have the free internet access available. Also, breakfast on-site on the patio was very good. Just as an example of Allosandro's excellent service, after we got to Venice my wife realized that she left a sweater at a Pizzaria near the Bellesuite. I had paid with a credit card, so I had the name of the place. I emailed Allosandro at the hotel for help. I got a reply the same day that said that they had contacted the pizzaria, retrieved the sweater, and by what means did we need it sent to us. Above and beyond the call of duty. Also I would add a quick note about Angel Tours. We did the Vatican Tour one day and the Colloseum/Forum tour the next. Both days we had Ross as our tour guide. Both were well worth the 25E/pp. I am not sure how much of a line we skipped at the Vatican, as we still had to go through security, we definately walked past a long line to get into the Colloseaum as Ross had us buy our entrance tickets at an out of the way ticket booth during our walk around the Forum area. Probably saved an hour in line. Ross mentioned that the tours that charge by the hour don't seem to "know" about this other ticket booth.

Reviews.Title: “Pound for pound - the best value hotel in Italy!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jigsawman
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from my second stay at the Bellesuite, where once again I was impressed with the standards that are being maintained. The hotel is wonderfully equipped and spotlessly clean and the staff are polite and helpful to all. The hotel may lack the public rooms of some of the other large impersonal chain hotels but remember when in Rome you will find that you do a lot of walking and sightseeing, leaving you little time to use these facilities. Believe me when I say that you will not find a comparable hotel in Rome, in such a central and safe location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent night at Bellesuite Rome”
Reviews.Author: kellyitalia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bellesuite Rome with my new husband for one night of our honeymoon. We were staying in Sorrento for 10 nights and travelled to Rome for a night nearer the end of our holiday. The hotel staff could not welcome us any more than they did. Bruno was especially helpful. He helped us to our room and showed us the facilities. 2 glasses and red wine and a ice bucket was waiting for us on arrival. The minibar was minimal but had storage space for guests own beveridges and drinks from the minibar were not expensive. The room was fantastic. It was on the 3rd floor. It had an electronic safe which was free and remote control air conditioning. The room was very clean. The bathroom was nice and only contained a shower which was quite small. It was fine for a one night stay. We loved the old style elevator. Watch your head when walking in the main entrance!! The hotel does not have a large sign so it is easy to miss! The location was fantastic. I never felt like we were in any danger. We walked everywhere on the first night and took the metro to the vatican the next day. The metro station was only 2 mins walk from the hotel. We had dinner at the target inn which is round the corner and the service and meal was fantastic. Loved the house wine. All in all a great time and I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, nice hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: mikewynne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 3 nights of our honeymoon and were very pleased with our choice. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet - a deliciously cool and comfortable haven from the midsummer heat of Rome. The service was exceptional throughout our stay, with the staff very efficient and helpful. All the sites were walkable from the hotel and when we were tired of walking there was a metro station just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in June and stayed at the Bellesuite Hotel for a total of 4 days. The Hotel was great. The rooms where very clean and nice with all the things you need on a trip to Rome. The Bellesuite is located in walking distance to some of the major attractions in Rome. The underground and the train station is 5-10 min. walk away, just remember to walk through the station when you come from the airport. . The terrace is a grate place for typical Italian breakfast with fresh pastry and the coffee of your choice. The service at the hotel was exceptionally good and very friendly. We called a restaurant to reserve a table, but we got the message that all the tables where booked so we asked the staff to call for us and when we came back from a long day in the city they had ordered us a nice table at the restaurant. The Beelesuite is good value for money and the service and location could not have been better

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: telli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bellesuite Rome for 1 night at the end of our Italy holiday. The hotel is well located and is spotlessly clean. The concierge was very helpful and friendly and the room was more than adequate. Bonus's were the free internet and library and the in room DVD player and flat screen TV. Breakfast was served on the terrace and offered a good selection. We would definely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: don527
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone I just came back from staying at the Bellesuite Hotel this past June 2006 for a total of 4 days. It is a fantastic Hotel. It is exceptionally spotless and clean. You could not ask for a cleaner hotel room, bathroom... The rooms are large. There is plenty of room and there is a safe where you can store all your belongings and valuables. The location is great. We would catch the 40 or 64 bus to go to the Vatican, Plaza Novana, Pantheon... We could also walk for 15 minutes to get to Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps. The breakfasts are fantastic. There are cappichinos, pastries, juices, yogurts, cereals... Any one who could complain about this breakfast is probably an overweight , spoiled American who is nothing better to do. Breakfasts have always been my favorite meal of the day, and this is a great breakfast to start the day. The people at the hotel are absolutely the best !!!! You get personal service, help with any manner or issue. Allejandro confirmed our flights, our pickups to the pier (for our cruise) and was always there to help and assist. We had an issue with our A/C, and Allejandro got it fixed right awayYou get free internet access. The only thing I could comment on with concern is the bathroom. I will admit they are a bit small and it is a tight squeeze into the shower, but is something I could live with for 10 minutes a day. Allejandro, Bruno and the rest, you are really great !!! Regards Don

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at BelleSuiteRome hotel”
Reviews.Author: mw400
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the BelleSuiteRome hotel (Via Modena n.5, Rome, Italy. Tel 011-39-064 84 466) in Rome. The staff was very helpful. The room was airy, clean and pleasant. The hotel is centrally located and is very convenient to walk to the Termini train/bus station. We would definitely return to stay at this hotel when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “BelleSuite delivered!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We “discovered” BelleSuite thanks to Trip Advisor. We wanted a hotel that was “Rome” in character, was well located in terms of safety and walking distance to most attractions and public transport, was reasonably priced by Rome standards, yet had most of the amenities we North Americans take for granted in our hotels. A tall order… BelleSuite delivered. (Don’t be put off by the street and exterior when you first arrive, or the elevator. It’s Rome!) Unlike a previous reviewer, we booked online through Venere, and they were prompt and helpful with their replies. Double standard room was 150 Euros a night. Cancellation policy was 3 days before arrival without charge. We stayed at BelleSuite for three nights in mid-May, wanting to see as much of Rome as we could before taking a Mediterranean Cruise. We arrived around 1:00 p.m., quite tired after our Trans-Atlantic flight, and very relieved to learn that our room was ready. Our room (303), though smallish, was spotlessly clean with high ceilings and modern decor, a fair-sized bathroom with tub/shower combination, flat-screen TV, electric blinds, remote controlled air-conditioning (which worked!), and a comfortable bed. Noise was not a problem, as this room faced the back, across from the terrace where we had breakfast. As for breakfast, it was more than adequate: a generous continental breakfast with choice of coffee; we had cappuccino. The terrace was a lovely setting, and an opportunity to meet some interesting people. We also took advantage of the free Internet service every day. (Quite a deal, compared to the .75 cents a minute on our cruise.) As other reviewers have mentioned, the staff was friendly and very helpful. We’ve really appreciated the hints that previous reviewers have shared, so here are ours: 1) For an inexpensive overview tour of Rome, take the #110 open top red bus, but be prepared to stand in line for tickets at the Termini. We took the hop-on hop-off option for 13 Euros, but getting back on the bus sometimes took too much time. In hindsight, we’d do the less expensive (8 or 9 Euros, I think) 90 minute tour where you stay on the bus, and can work your way to the top of the bus as people exit. This narrated tour using earphones is sketchy but adequate, especially if you carry a guidebook such as Rick Steves’. 2) Agree with previous reviewer that the Target restaurant just around the corner is very good, better than some of the hotel’s recommendations. (You may want to check menus to see if there is a charge for bread. On our first evening we had a wonderful pasta dinner near the Spanish Steps, but were surprised to see a charge of 3 Euros for a very limited bread basket which we had assumed was included with the meal.) 3) Be prepared to get lost. Some of the narrow side streets aren’t noticeably named, especially around the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, so your map doesn’t always help. Fortunately, there are always people around you, many of them carrying maps and as lost as you. We’d definitely stay at the BelleSuite again. And this time, we’d use the elevator, which looked archaic, but as we learned on our last day, was actually quite user-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My apprehensiveness melted away as soon as we arrived! Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: mlcurrie
Reviews.Content: When researching hotels for our trip to Italy, I was addicted to Tripadvisor. That is exactly how I found Bellesuite in Rome and my other hotels. After booking Bellesuite, I became VERY apprehensive because I began seeing some not so positive comments. However, we had the BEST experience while travelling in Rome at the Bellesuite. Some things to note: 1. Be aware that when you make a reservation at Bellesuite through their website and have to cancel your reservation at any time (even if it is one hour after you made the reservation), there is a penalty of 1 night's fee. We did not have that problem, but that is something you should be aware of because I did not know that until after I booked the room. 2. After I booked the room through their website, I attempted to email the hotel on several occasions. All of my emails were returned to me as undeliverable. I am not sure what kind of trouble they have communicating with some email accounts. However, I emailed a person who had listed their email address on Tripadvisor and asked about contacting the hotel. The person actually emailed the hotel for me and the hotel emailed me within a day. After that, I had no troubles at all contacting the hotel. This is also something to be aware of when trying to email the hotel. It made me very nervous, but everything worked out perfectly! 3. When we arrived in Rome, we took the train from the airport to the Termini. Alessandro (hotel manager) had given me directions to the hotel from the train station and said it would take 5 minutes to walk. If we had known where exactly we were going and were familiar with the area, it would have only taken 5 minutes, but it actually took us over 20 minutes. The train from the airport comes in at the opposite end of the train station, so that added about 8-10 minutes to our walk. If you are planning to walk to the hotel (bags and all) from the train station, make sure you have already plotted it on a map that you are at the southernmost end of the train station when you arrive. **Since we arrived in the daytime, we had no trouble at all finding the hotel. Be aware that there is only a small sign noting where the hotel is, but it is easy to find. 4. Bruno greeted us at the front desk when we arrived and although his English is limited, he was wonderful to us! He was extremely friendly and made us feel welcome. We arrived early in the day (before 11 a.m.) and our room was already ready for us. Bruno helped carry our bags to the 3rd floor, as the reception area is on the 2nd floor. 5. We had a double room with a bathtub, room 303. Although the room was small, it is spotlessly clean and had everything we needed! The bathroom was better than I had imagined, considering the comments I had seen on this website. The bathtub was big enough for my husband and me--and we are not very small people. If you are a couple, this room will be perfect for you. 6. Breakfast--Again, I was skeptical about it after reading comments on Tripadvisor, but it was perfect for us. The staff was very hospitible and served us promptly. We ate on the breakfast terrace each morning and enjoyed it everyday. The breakfast is not what you typically have in the U.S. (with bacon, eggs, pancakes, etc.), but it was a feast compared to what I've had in Italy before for breakfast. 7. Concierage--WONDERFUL! Alessandro, Bruno, and Joyia (not sure about the spelling of her name) were so helpful to us. They booked train tickets to Florence for us and gave us any information we needed. 2 things that you need to make sure you know before you stay at Bellesuite: 1. My husband and I liked the Target restaurant that was right by the hotel, but we did not like the other restaurant recommendations from the hotel. Keep that in mind. 2. IF YOU ARE PAYING YOUR BILL WITH CASH, MAKE SURE TO HAVE THE EXACT CHANGE. They do not seem to keep change at the hotel, so we ran into a problem with paying because we needed 25 euros in change. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at Bellesuite! It was much better than I ever imagined it would be and we would stay there again! We are so happy that we made the decision to stay there for our trip to Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: blivet
Reviews.Content: We concur with every positive comment made about this clean, convenient, very reasonably priced, and well located hotel. What stood out most was the extraordinary service...and...with a smile! They arranged everything we needed. Train tickets and confirmed reservations were delivered to the hotel and conveniently charged to the hotel room at no additional cost. They arranged a private tour for four of Vatican City with door to door service (Miguel...a Roman treasure and native) where we went to the head of the line consisting of several thousand people when we arrived at 9:30 AM. All for the price of an average lunch.The BelleSuite has our undivided loyalty for any future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Well pleased”
Reviews.Author: rarrar
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly service; breakfast now in your room or on the terrace (recommended) was the typical continental type with range of pastries,breads, salami, cheeses and 2 cereals. Free Internet access and pad of streetmaps ideal for checking up on sites etc in Rome. Paid by credit card - no surcharge ! There are 2 grades of rooms - ours was large but a bit noisy but what do you expect in a city? Found cheap selfservice lunch cafe 5mins away up Via Firenza just before V Barberini on the right - easy to use and frequented by local office workers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pixfield
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strengths of the reviews on this site and I was not disappointed. This hotel deserves an "excellent" rating. I stayed at the BelleSuite for 9 nights in April, 2006. The hotel is clean, comfortable, and quiet. The staff is courteous, responsive, and helpful. The rooms are decorated very nicely, and they are pleasant. 24/7 Internet service is free. In-room TV's have 1,000 (yes, 1,000) channels but only a few are in English. The hotel is located within a 90 second walk to the metro, about 30 seconds to Via Nazionale where some very convenient bus stops are located, and about a 6 minute walk to the Termini rail station (but a bus stop close to the hotel takes you right to Termini). It is on a quiet and safe street. I would stay at this hotel again and I strongly recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - and not a great location”
Reviews.Author: MADberg
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a hotel in the typical European small hotel style. It's not a complete building unto itself, in fact it shares a building with Hotel Adler and Cellini among others. The room was fine - smallest of our trip, but not cramped. It was clean, had internet, etc. The problem I had with this hotel was the location. Essentially any outing took an extra 20 minutes on each side for walking or cab time. We were pretty much never where we wanted to be (it's near the train station, but we came by plane and left by car). All major sites and shopping areas and other points of interest are simply not near this place - I'd highly recommend staying at least 10 blocks west closer to the Pantheon/Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps area in the nook of the Tiber.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but facilities have changed”
Reviews.Author: DiamondChris
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Bellesuite, having booked on the strength of reviews on this website. The location was excellent and we were able to walk everywhere, even the Vatican (50 mins) from the hotel. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. However, at the time of booking, breakfast was served at the George Byron Cafe on the corner which did not concern us and we felt it would be rather nice to eat on our way out for the day. Everyone had said how good it was. On arrival we were told breakfast would be served in our room. We were asked every day what time we wanted it for the following day and they were always either too early or not the same time so that you were always caught out in the shower or not dressed ! The breakfast was appalling. For two of us we got just one croissant and one sweet roll between us plus two packets of crisp Melba toast with some jam and coffee. We had to eat it on our laps or on the bed as there was no table as such to eat from. Most unsatisfactory and not value for money - I would rather pay less for the hotel and have no breakfast. Even when we asked for two croissants - they never came! On the last day we saw that there was a breakfast room on the second floor and also a nice terrace with tables and chairs -why we were not offered breakfast in either of these areas, we will never know. When we asked a question it was met with a look of "we dont understand you"! We also knew the bathroom was small from other reviews but room 306 was ludicrous. The shower door jammed when you were in there and had to be kicked from the inside to open it and when it was open it hit the sink - thats how small the bathroom was. Nowhere to dry yourself and no shelves for any toiletries or shaving facilities. Also in this particular room there is a very dangerous step down from the bedroom to the bathroom with no defining line and I fell very badly one night resulting in a black eye. The hotel has changed I fear as the husband and wife team that everyone talked about I never met, there seemed to be someone new at the reception every day. Very expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge makes BelleSuite the Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The BelleSuite Rome is a charming small hotel located on a couple floors of a building within walking distance of Termini. Just a couple blocks west on Nationale, then one block north on Torino, turn left on the first street (Modina) and the big double wooden doors are on the left. If the door is not open, look for the buzzer and they'll ring you in - reception is on the second floor. The rooms are immaculately clean and updated - and we found the location excellent for those who want to stay a bit away from the mass of tourists. We could easily walk to all the major sites(the longest walk being Vatican city) and we had the benefit of having many "locals" restaurants around us. The Target Ristorante downstairs from the hotel was excellent - be sure and have the Risotto Pere y Gorgonzole - incredible! But with everything else - Alessandro (the head concierge) and Jolia (the evening concierge) made our experience even more memorable. They helped us with our struggling Italian, gave us great restaurant and wine shop recommendations and more. My husband and I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LushLinds
Reviews.Content: The Bellesuite is a clean, comfortable, well situated, friendly hotel. We stayed for 3 nights and found it convenient for the bus station, main sights and metro. The breakfast was served in our rooms and was a basic continental breakfast, which varied slightly day by day. If you drink tea with milk make sure you ask for hot water and cold milk, otherwise it is served luke warm with hot milk (hint for all of Rome not just hotel!) We ate at lots of different places. There was only 1 place that was not that great and that was called Renaldi, via Palma. Otherwise good restaurants were Santopadre, via collina, 18 - typical rome restaurant, not touristy. Target just below the Bellesuite, we also ate in via moderna and snacked at a lot of takeaway pizza places for lunch! If you look slightly off the beaten track here are some wonderful coffee shops and gelaterias. Also we liked Cafe Byron, near termini just round the corner from Bellesuite as a bar. All of the restaurants etc are no smoking which is quite refreshing! As for the sights, buy Colluseum tickets at the Palitino and this avoids big queues at the main ticket office, and get to the Vatican early, it opens at 8.45 and the queues are long, I would aim to get there by 8am. As for Terravision, this is a good service to get to and from the airport, but on the way back do not get fobbed off about being on a bus too early. Stand your ground and let them know that you want to get on the bus you want. We had a wonderful time in Rome and will definitly be returning to the Bellesuite but next time to shop!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel. Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: blondiebee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 day stay at the Bellesuite. We booked it from the reviews on tripadvisor. When we go away to a city, we want value for money, close to the city centre, clean and safe. Thats exactly what you get with this hotel. Like the other reviews state, its on a quite street and its a small doorway, its on the second and third floor of the building, there is another hotel on another floor. Its exceptionally clean, marble and modern. The rooms are not huge, but they have everything you could want for a city break (we are only there to sleep after a 10 hour trail around the city, so not much time is spent in the hotel). The room had comfy bed, tv, sky, mini bar, electric curtains, shutters, marble bathroom, bath, shower. The room was cleaned every day spotless. My daughter had a single room, which again was'nt huge, but enough for what she needed. They had air conditioning, heating, there was nothing else we needed. You even get breakfast delivered every morning to your room, which is continental, croissants,rolls, pastries, coffee, yoghurts,biscuits, toast, this is ample for anybody. Absolutely nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They are there 24 hours a day and the hotel is very secure. There is unlimited internet, free in the lobby which was useful. I can not fault this hotel at all, i would certainly recommend it. Rome was lovely and we even went to florence by train for the day (one and half hours and approx 55 euro each, definately worth the trip by intercity). We got to the centre of Rome by the airport shuttle, 48 euros for the three of us, 40 min trip. However, next to the shuttle stop is a public transport bus at 2 euro each! which i would do next time. If you do go on the shuttle bus, make sure you allow a little more time to get to the airport on your return, we waited just over an hour because the coaches were busy and by the time we got to the airport we only had 45 minutes til take off. Another tip is if you want to do the open top bus tours, find the city sightseeing bus, only 12 euro per person and a global company. All the others based at the Termini were anything from 25 euros per person. Lovely city, lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: alelstree
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Bellesuite and have found a little Gem. Friendly service from Allesando and staff, great location (walking distance to most sights), good facilities in rooms (Sky Sports etc), Continental breakfast in room, Internet service (free). What more does one want? Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good ...”
Reviews.Author: viendomundo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this "hotel" during 5 days and effectivily is really clean, the staff is very nice and the rooms are well equipped. But the size of the bathroom - at least at room 301 - and the noise in the room (not inside the building that is very quiet) I speak about the noise of the street because the window is very old and you can hear the cars like if the window was opened. And the breakfast is poor even for a continental breakfast. I can not recomended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During our first trip to Rome, I booked us at the BelleSuite based on TripAdvisor recommendations. The hotel is lovely, although it is unlike any other hotels where we have stayed. It is on the second floor of a building it shares with many other businesses. While BelleSuite is close to the train station and not far from tourist sites, I think it is more suited to business travellers than tourists. It is impecably clean, although my husband complained the bathroom was so small he had no place to set his shaving kit. The staff were very helpful and we received a thank you email when we got home. The breakfast room is very small and the offering so-so. Overall, I thought it a comfortable hotel, but I'm not sure I would stay there again preferring something a little more visible and accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern rooms, friendly staff, limited breakfast”
Reviews.Author: beccx
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days in Rome, having booked the Bellesuite on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews. Had no problem locating the hotel and we were not disappointed when shown to our room. Very modern and clean with DVD, satellite TV, flat screen TV and a large double bed. The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate. Location wise, the Bellesuite can't be faulted. We walked to the Colloseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Campo Fiori, Pizza Navona etc. There's also a Metro station nearby at Republica which we used to get across to St Peter's and the Vatican Museums. Located just off Via Nazionale there was not too much noise from the traffic but obviously anywhere in central Rome isn't going to be car horn free and we were disturbed on occasions. Not the end of the world though at all. All the staff that we came into contact with were very friendly and helpful. They were even able to point us in the direction of a bar showing English football (we arrived in the middle of FA Cup weekend!) The hotel has a free internet connection and a selection of guide books and also provides a really useful free map which we used extensively. We even arrived home to an e-mail from the hotel thanking us for our stay and hoping that we had enjoyed it. A nice little touch that you don't usually get. The only thing that lets this hotel down is the breakfast. It's served in a tiny room on the 2nd floor and if there are more than a couple of tables occupied it feels very cramped. The selection of food is also quite poor, even for a continental breakfast -cereal, bread, pastries and yoghurt was all there was on offer. The addition of some cold meats or cheeses would have improved this no end and may have resulted in an 'excellent' review rather than just 'above average'. We ate at the Target restaurant on the corner of via Modena and were very impressed. The service, food and wine were all fantastic and we thought it was excellent value for money. Highly recommended. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Bellesuite and would certainly stay here again if we return to Rome. Not something that I would say of hotels that I've stayed in in other European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated business hotel”
Reviews.Author: hesketh27
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of the glowing reports it had received on this site. The hotel is extremely clean, the rooms are comfortable and modern. It is well situated within walking distance of Termini Station and it is easy to walk to all of the central tourist attractions (only the Vatican is too far on foot).We are not the type of travellers to be fussing around the staff finding out their names/asking for recomendations etc.. so cannot comment except to say that they were courteous, pleasant and efficient which is all we ask. We checked in at the Hotel Adler desk which is on the second floor of the building, then we were taken up to the third floor, which is the Bellesuite. Breakfast is in a tiny room on the second floor and consists of cereals, croissants, cakes, juice etc.. very basic fare. All in all, a pleasant stay in what amounts to a business type hotel. If you are looking for a reasonably priced place for a couple of nights this place fits the bill, but dont be taken in by the romantic praises of some of the reviews otherwise you will be disappointed. General Tips - there is little in the way of nightlife in the vicinity of the hotel (bars etc..) best place is Flann O'Briens Irish Pub on the Via Nazzionale just round the corner from the Bellesuite. It is always busy with a nice mix of locals and tourists. It also serves good quality food throughout the day. If you are using a budget airline to Ciampino Airport, book your coach transfer to Termini on the Terravision website and walk it from the station to the hotel. When returning give yourself plenty of time to get back to the airport - coaches can get very full and the traffic in the morning can make the 30 minute journey to the airport much longer. Enjoy your trip to Rome - we certainly did!

Reviews.Title: “Note: Big Changes Have Taken Place Here”
Reviews.Author: Awarely
Reviews.Content: It should be noted that Belle Suite is part of the third floor of a downtown building containing several hotels and businesses/offices. (The top rated Residence Cellini is on the same floor, but we have no way to evaluate that hotel.) Because of the Trip Advisor reviews and ratings, we booked a suite here for four days in February, 2006, through Venere which was what came up on our computer screen unexpectedly through, I believe, the Trip Advisor website, but I cannot be certain. In any case, when we arrived they had no record of our reservation! So, the kind lady behind the desk (who spoke excellent English) arranged for us instead to stay in a single room on part of the second floor, which is called Hotel Adler, just a floor below Belle Suite. Note that the reception area for both is now on the second floor; the third floor reception desk is now the free high speed internet access for both Hotel Adler and Belle Suite as well. Both the staff and we were pleased that there was a room available on such short notice, so no great harm done. However, surprise! Both these hotels are now operated under single management! So, we got a single room instead of a suite and paid 1/3 less! This was okay, but we never saw Belle Suite rooms and so cannot comment on them. However, we also discovered that the breakfast room for both Hotel Adler and Belle Suite were now the same second floor room. We will leave a review of Hotel Adler at that place on the Trip Advisor website. However, we should comment that the breakfast was really not very good. The food was not very fresh and we were not offered second servings of hot drinks. (we didn't ask, either) The juice was not very tasty and there was no cheese, or cold cuts, or eggs, etc. Just some croissants, granola, rolls and jam, milk, and such. Let me acknowledge that the staff went out of their way to assist us in many ways. For this reason I rate the hotel neutral instead of okay with some problems. I lost my wallet due to a pickpocket on the Metro (even though we are experienced in travel; WARNING--all it takes is a momentary lapse of caution) and the hotel allowed us to make several long calls back to the US to cancel credit cards, and charged us nothing! The reception attendant also called and reserved for us a time to see the Galleria Borghesi, like a great concierge would. Others have commented how poorly marked is the hotel building, and how central it is to Rome, but next time we stay at Villa San Pio for charm sake. Hint: Visit Ostia Antica which is a 1/2 hour train ride from the station next to the Pyramid Metro station. There is a great statuary museum and a sense of stillness and history quite different from the Forum or Colosseum. It requires a lot of walking, but is well marked in English and one of the highlights of greater Rome.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: wimpiot
Reviews.Content: good location near the station, near the via Nationale, correct room, shower a little bit too small for 1,89 meter, every-one very kind, but breakfast is very bad, at 9 o'clock no bread anymore, but i will return !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Papofurado
Reviews.Content: Weekend stay at the Bellesuite, chosen largely as a result of the positive postings on Tripadvisor. I'm happy to endorse most of the positive comments in that the hotel is centrally located and maintained to a high standard - the room we had was immaculate and tastefully decorated/furnished. Be warned, however, that the reception is on the second floor. We also found the hotel difficult to find in the dark - the street in which it is located is not well lit. We arrived late in the evening, deciding to walk from the Terminee (straightforward) and found the street easily enough, but we found the hotel quite difficult to locate - it does not have an illuminated sign, and enquiries with a number of 'locals' drew blank expressions when asking for directions to the hotel. In fact, we had passed the hotel several times before a receptionist from another nearby hotel helped us find it!! We saw the small sign for the Bellesuite next morning on our way out sightseeing. Otherwise, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over all it was a great hotel, but a big disappointment with hotel breakfast.It is a great base for sight seeing in rome.Quite difficult to locate due to inaccurate directions on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: Tiggr6381
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at the BelleSuite from Dec. 17-25, 2005. It was great. Alessandro and his staff were most accommodating. He responded to my emails promptly when we were looking to book a room. (I didn't check anywhere else as the prior recommendations from TripAdvisor sold me on this hotel.) Cost was 100 Euro per night. WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AND WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN. Hotel: It is near the train station and easy to find. The train was 9.50 Euro from the airport and leaves every 30 minutes. The trip was about 25 minutes. From the station, it was about a 15-minute walk or so to get to BelleSuite. When leaving the train station, continue on the main level the entire way...it's smooth (marble and not cobble stone) and no 'vendors' asking if you want a ride. (we walked down the stairs and were 'hit on' right away.) At the front of the station, there are taxis waiting, if you choose to take one. We downloaded a map from this website. The hotel is located on the second floor. (Third in U.S. terms as their ‘first’ floor is our ‘second’ floor.) Our room was 203, on the second floor. It was very spacious. While the shower is small for U.S. standards, it is pretty normal for European bathrooms. My boyfriend is 6'4" and had no problem...and, when in Rome... I used the elevator only to haul my luggage when we checked in/out. Otherwise, the 55 (or so) steps were good exercise. Breakfast was from 7:30-10:00 on the main floor. All the staff was most helpful with answering our questions and offering assistance. While one person spoke very little English, we had no problem communicating with the others. Location: We loved the location. We walked everywhere and never took a cab or Metro. They have a great map for your use (it's available at different locations in the city, too). Internet: free on third floor. Language: Most people spoke English. No problems anywhere. Money: Use your debit/check card. Much better exchange rate (by $.10). DON'T use Western Union...they charge a commission and rip you off. The vendors that say 'change' on the outside are reasonable, but the cost was $.10 more than using a debit card for money. Restaurants: Alessandro recommended Target, Cafe Rinaldi (can't remember remainder of name), and Pentolaccia. They were all excellent. We found Popi-Popi in Trastevere neighborhood to be excellent, too. Limoncello (a liqueur) was our dessert every night...mmm good. Sites: Did the usual sites -- churches, Colosseum, Palatino hill, Forum area, Pantheon, Tomb of Unknown Soldier, St. Peter's Basilica, Vatican, Sistine Chapel, Castle of St. Angelo, Piazza del Popolo, Spanish Steps (Scalinata Trinita dei Monti), Piazza Navona. Ended up attending mass at Santa Maria in Trastevere as we got there 15 minutes before. Stayed for a short time. Attended a choral concert at Santa Maria degli Angeli. Attended midnight Mass on Christmas Eve at St. Peter's Basilica. Didn't have a ticket (free) to be inside. Watched from outside on the Jumbo Tron. Got there at 9:00...could have waited until 11:00. However, if you get a ticket, get there around 6:00 or 7:00 to stand in line. The Basilica seats 7,000. Safety: We always felt safe, even when walking late at night. Wear comfortable shoes. I wore light hikers from Lands End with a Spenco insert. They worked great. Feel free to ask any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Roma bella!”
Reviews.Author: jmepani
Reviews.Content: As a family of 5 we went to Rome as a surprise for my dads 50th birthday. We stayed at the Bellesuite Rome for 3 nights over new years and enjoyed our time there. Alessandro and the rest of the staff were very helpful and welcoming, we had free internet access, maps, and the staff were happy to make reservations on our behalf. However the only negative point is that my parent’s room was on the same floor as the reception and I shared with my sisters on the 3rd floor. The difference in the quality of the rooms is very noticeable and my parent’s room had basic decor in terms of the room and bathroom, also there was no shower curtain. On the other hand my room had a flat screen TV, DVD player and was very comfortable and matched the photos on the hotel site. I cannot say if all rooms on 2nd floor were like this but I would advise requesting a room on the 3rd floor if you are staying here. (Unfortunately didn’t take pics of the basic room) The other comment I would like to make is the basic choice of breakfast which was now in fact being served in a room on the second floor and not in the Target restaurant as previous visitors have experienced. If you like cereal and pastries this is OK, but not for those that like a hearty hot breakfast. Lastly we found the area to be perfectly safe with a good range of shops and restaurants around the corner of the hotel. All the sites are in walking distance (15-20mins to colosseum, capitoline museum, palatine hill, forum) and about 45mins to vatican city. It is a city centre to be walked and we did not have to take the cab or the metro anywhere. I would easily stay here again if I come to Rome. Final comments: - recommend at 10euros each is to ride the Time Elevator situated off via del corso, it will give you the history of Rome and the changes the city has gone through during a 45minute interactive ride. - check opening times of sites with hotel staff, they are frequently changed and will differ from travel guides as we found - queue early for colosseum and vatican museums, even in winter the amount of tourists that visit will mean long waits - none of the sights and very few shops are open for new years day. Restaurants on new years eve are either fully booked, have a set menu that is fairy costly or are closed, so book well in advance. - visit to the sistine chapel is a must and will blow you away even if you are not an art lover Rome is a fantastic city like no other and hope all that visit have a great time as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJeny
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 2 days. This place is fabulous. I really couldn't believe I was staying here for the price I paid. The hotel is located on the 3rd floor of a building. It's very modern. The room and bathroom are absolutely beautiful. You couldn't ask for a better location. The subway is close by and the historic part of Rome is walking distance away. You really can't beat the value. The staff was so helpful and spoke english very well. It's about 50 Euros to the airport. You can take the subway but it takes double the time.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but wary of the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right near the Central train station which normally I would say is well located except that we didn't get the safest feeling around there and changed hotels because of it. The hotel is on one floor of an old building which is fine in itself but the only way up is via a narrow old rickety lift which initially I thought would be endearing but found it to be inconvenient when travelling with large suitcases that are heavy. This also meant I had to leave my fiance downstairs whilst I went up to find the suites as the level it is located on is not well marked from the front or in the lift and no-one came down to help us so we had to work it all out ourselves which did not give us a very good first impression. I like that the room has windows that open out for fresh air and the air con worked well, which was welcome as it was 30 degrees when we arrived. The staff don't speak very good English at all, not even basic English which made it a bit more difficult. Maybe we should learn more Italian for next time we're in Rome. The room is spacious except the shower very narrow for anyone over 6ft. The restaurant downstairs and around the corner called Target had very nice food but the service to get in was terrible. We had to show huge displeasure just to get some attention, but that is mainly because of the young guys waiting the tables. The old guy made up for it and the young waitresses were also very nice. I wouldn't say the hotel is that well located to tourist attractions if that is the reason for your travel but the train station is very close. But walking around is pretty easy even if it was hot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the Bellesuite for a surprise trip for my wife's birthday, wow what a good move.Having read reveiws on this website I was looking forward to staying at this hotel and exploring the city. The Bellesuite is a tremendous base for touring around, the staff at the hotel are absolutely fantastic, they make your stay most pleasurable.Bruno is a legend..he can't do enough for you.The Cafe bar where breakfast is served also provides great service and offers ample breakfast to start the day.I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “book it asap!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great service, great room, great location and great city. top marks.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: MrsMungo
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a whirlwind weekend stay in Rome and so much wanted to pay compliments to the Bellesuite. We arrived early at the hotel, and was shown to our room with no hassle. Lovely modern and very clean room with very large and comfortable bed. All the staff were really nice and even reminded me when returning late Saturday night to turn my watch back by an hour (due to daylight saving). Breakfast at the nearby George Byron cafe was a treat too. The only slight negative was the small size of the bathroom. Loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were traveling in Italy for our honeymoon, with Rome being the last stop. We found the Belle Suite on the internet and booked it solely based upon a link on the internet. Although it was a little tight for the shuttle bus (one one of Rome's notoriously narrow lanes), we found the amenities and service to be top notch. Allessandro met us at the entrance and helped us carry the bags to the elevator and our room. We actually checked in a and got settled before presenting credit cards, etc!! The location, near the Plaza Republica, is about as convenient to EVERYWHERE in Rome as you would need. If you don't wish to walk, the hotel staff will call you a cab. As a manager/conceriege, Allessandro is the best. He helped us with whatever we needed. Breakfast is served around the corner at a lovely bakery/cafe. The 'Target" restaurant nearby might possiblly serve the best food in Rome. The BelleSuite is a boutique hotel, with wonderful amenities and world class service. We would recommend this to seasoned or first time travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Bellesuite !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a lovely 4 night stay at the Bellesuite in Rome. We could not have asked for more. The staff were extremely friendly, the hotel was clean and the room was modern and luxurious (could be compared with many 5 star hotels). After long days of sight seeing and a nice meal, a bath and a DVD rented from reception were all we needed to keep us entertained. The cleaners kept the room immaculate and the breakfast was more than enough in a very nice cafe situated just around the corner from the hotel. The hotel was perfectly situated, we walked to most places and caught the tube to St Peters which was only 10 minutes away. The main station (Termini) was only a 5 minute walk away. We were very upset to leave Rome and the BelleSuite hotel and wish we had stayed for longer. We will visit Rome again and no doubt will look no further than the Bellesuite. Easily the most enjoyable stay we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Brill Bellesuite”
Reviews.Author: ChickenKiev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bellesuite for three days in September and found it to be an exceptional place to stay. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful from the outset and throughout our stay. The hotel is situated on the third floor of a building right around the corner from the Metro station and within easy walking distance of Termini Train Station. The rooms are very clean and modern with air con and a nice looking TV with DVDs on offer from the desk. Given it's location it's surprisingly quiet and safe. They have metal roller shutters which can be rolled down over the windows to shut out light completely...an absolute godsend if you really need to get over that jet lag or recover from the night on the town. The shower in our room was quite small...perfectly adequate for us though larger folk may have a bit of a problem. (The bathroom size varies so ask for one with a bath). The breakfast is served in a nice cafe around the corner and the hotel's breakfast policy seems to be quite loose with regards to time so you'll still be able to grab a coffee and a slice of toast even if you think you may have missed it. Overall an excellent place to stay though it was the staff who really made it so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great choice at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Priape
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous choice for our recent trip to Rome (Aug 16-22, 2005). The rooms were beautiful and modern, very nicely decorated and exceptionally clean. The staff was just wonderful and so very helpful in every way. I've read many reviews of hotels where the staff were less than helpful but with only 6-7 rooms here, you can't help but get to know them and develop a more personal relationship. Breakfast was included and was at the George Byron cafe around the corner. They too were very friendly and the service was great. We got OJ, coffee, a cornetto and toast and it was just fine. The price here was very reasonable and I found the location quite satisfactory. We were not too far from the train station, very close to the metro and bus lines and we walked almost everywhere. What a great way to see Rome - on foot! I'm sure there are many great locations in Rome but we would definitely stay here again in the future. I don't even think I would look elsewhere. Many thanks to Alessandro and all the staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The BelleSuite is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came across this hotel by using this site, so to thank all those who wrote before me and to help others planning their trips, I decided to post here as well. My husband and I just returned from 4 days in Rome, and we stayed at the BelleSuite. We loved the hotel and can't wait to go back. It was fabulous: everything we had hoped for. The rooms are lovely, modern and clean, and the staff is so friendly and helpful. It was a perfect vacation location.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read some terrible reviews on hotels in Rome i spent hours looking for a good one and the Belle Suite exceeded all my expectations.Having travelled quite alot i can honestly say that the staff were the most efficient and friendly people i have ever met. The hotel room was modern,spotless and more than adequate for a four day break in this wonderful city. Breakfast, as mentioned in other reviews was served in the George Byron Cafe around the corner from the hotel consisting of toast, croissants and tea/coffee.The location of the hotel was super in that it is a very short distance from the Termini Bus station but not too close!!!!It is also just off the Via Nazionale which has some nice shops and restaurants.The nearest metro station- Republica is less than a 5 minute walk.All in all Belle Suite is the perfect choice....go book it!!!

Reviews.Title: “ A Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JSJROD
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from a wonderful stay in Rome! I spent several hours researching on what hotel to stay at. Thanks to this website I selected the Bellesuite Hotel. It was an excellent choice. The staff was EXTREAMLY friendly and helpful. Excellent customer service from every member! I loved it. I will definitely go back and I will let everyone know that this is the ideal place to stay. Not only is the price reasonable, but the location is excellent! Walking distance to everything! The free breakfast was at this cute little caf�. The room was clean and very comfortable to stay in. I have a three year old daughter and she loved it. It was also my birthday and my husband asked the hotel at the very last minute if they could arrange something special for me. And within 10 hours they had a beautiful bouquet of flowers, Champaign, and cookies waiting for me in the room. It was great. I couldn�t ask for anything more in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, quiet, cool and secure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Bellesuite Hotel! The bedroom was large, air conditioned and very clean. The bed was large and comfortable. TV with DVD player, small fridge and safe were all welcome amenities. The bathroom was spotless but very small. We had a room with a very small stand-up shower stall. If you are a larger person, be sure and ask for a room with the larger bathtub/shower combo or you may find yourself unable to get into the shower. The management and reception staff were exceptionally polite, friendly and helpful. The location was convenient to the Termini station and we were able to take long walks in the late evening to see the spectacularly lit fountains and monuments of Rome without feeling unsafe in the least. The breakfast is basic and is served at a corner bar near the hotel. We did not always find the serving staff at the bar very friendly, unfortunately. The reception staff was always willing to wake us up by bringing us tea or coffee to our room in the morning, if we requested and that was a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Look any Further...this is the Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CuriousNYC
Reviews.Content: We were originally very wary of the Belle Suite Rome because we heard so many bad things about hotels in near the train station. But do not worry...the Bellesuite is not in a bad location! The hotel has an elevator, where we were greeted by Alessandro, who helped us with our luggage. The rooms were great! Clean, roomy, air-conditioned...what more can I ask for? The room also had dvd player, a safe, and a refrigerator!) Alessandro made sure our stay was perfect...giving us great restaurant and gelateria recommendations. He also allowed us to use the hotels laptop to chack our mail....at no charge! We walked everywhere from our hotel...I have to admit...St. Peter's was a bit far. Stay at the Belle Suite...you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Service!!”
Reviews.Author: feedbackmeister
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel and the staff! The hotel was in a great location (close to major sights and walking distance to the Rome Termini Train Station). The room was spacious, tastefully decorated and very clean. I believe the hotel only opened in 2004. The staff was also very helpful and knowledgeable about Rome/things to do etc. (Especially Alessandro - thank you so much for your hospitality.) I definitely recommend this hotel.
